review: Food hit the spot and tasted perfect! Our server was Evan and he was very attentive, helpful, and nice! Great experience.

There was a weird substance on my knife and I asked the waiter what it was, he replied by picking it up wiping it off with his bare finger and placed it back on the table.. saying "magic it's gone". Absolutely disgusting

Worst service ever! Now I can remember why it's been 4 years I haven't been here, this place seems like high school kids are running it and no one knows what they are doing. It took almost a hour to get our food and this place is only 50% filled. This place needs to re-train or get a new manager that knows what they are doing. I know I won't come back here!! Wow smh!!!

It's been a while since I've been to any Red Robin.  I got the pig out tavern burger with their famous unlimited garlic fries. Wow, things have changed. The pig out burger was so small. I don't remember the burgers being that small. It tasted okay, just not as delicious as before. I think I could have gotten a better burger at Carl's Jr. The 6 dollar burger at Carl's Jr is much better and bigger than the overpriced Red Robin burger. Also, I was so disappointed in the fries. I used to love their garlic fries. It was made with real garlic and the fries used to be so flavorful. Now, the garlic fries have no real garlic and they just sprinkle it with garlic powder.  Such wasted calories for a less than mediocre meal. I definitely will not be back.
I love their crispy chicken burger it's really tasty.  All the workers are always friendly.
Slooooow. It was over 5 minutes before we even saw a host to seat us. Once we were finally seated, we waited 15 minutes to even see our server to get some ice water. And it's not even full in here!

I live close to Red Robin but had never gone to the restaurant. The restaurant was not crowded at all but the waiters seemed to be running around like it was, a bit odd. What was strange that in addition to our waiter, two other waiters brought our food in stages which was ok because at times, we could not even flag him down for refills of the drinks, etc. The food was excellent and on point. The sweet potato French fries are the way to go. The onion rings were good as well.  The Teriyaki burger was the best and grilled pineapple made this burger awesome. I would go there again. I think it is best to eat in and avoid take out.

TMI, but imma just come out and say it: after eating here, i got the worst stomach-ache and diarrhea i've ever had in my life. immediately after eating, i felt sick to my stomach.  Now normally, i'm really good with food and i LOVE spice, but i've never felt so sick like this before. i felt sick the entire night afterwards and now it's 2 and i've spent the last little while just in agonizing pain. ): EDIT: its 3:30 now and i'm miserable and nauseous still.. it wasn't too busy and service was alright, even tho our server did come to the table a little late to ask for drinks. (he was easy to flag down to ask for more condiments, etc, and was there to help with the little pay/game machine at the end).  the food was alright while we were eating. I was starving so i dug in right away.  i ordered the A1 peppercorn burger and my mom ordered the fish & chips. the fried onion in the burger was really wilted and slightly greasy but i love fried onions and it wasn't too bad. the presentation was a bit lacking, especially compared to the images in the menu (and i know, of course there would be a difference) but i did think to myself it was a little depressing how different they were  can't comment on the fish & chips since it's not my favorite dish anyways, but my mom liked it.  but i will definitely never be coming here again ): this was my first time trying red robbins and i'm not ending my night a happy camper.

I don't know where all these bad reviews are coming from... I came in on a super busy Saturday night and was attended to right away, this is by far one of the BEST burger spot I have been to in the whole of LA and I am a burger fanatic (this ranks next to Umami Burger)  The service was fast, the food was prepared very well (and in under 20 mins) - the meat was perfectly tender but properly cooked (I am very picky about my meat being properly well done). The servers were sweet and friendly, and never gave us any attitude for continously asking for condiments and they were always attentive.  I love their concept of bottomless steak fries (i love potato) and that their burgers are so gourmet but also comfort-food styled. They have really unique blends and combinations, from avocado to caramelised onion blends to teriyaki pineapple.  I loved my southern burger, I highly recommend the sweet bbq and caramelised onion combination on their nice bun that wasn't ever soggy! The meat portion was just right too, any thicker and I would have felt nauseas from being overfed.  The oreo cookie lover milkshake was JUST right too, I loved how it wasn't too thick or sugary, it made it easier to enjoy the whole milkshake without feeling sugar high.

Honestly really bad service !! I was seated for 25 minutes before I decided to go ask someone to actually give me some water . After someone finally decided to help me I got my burger and it was practically raw ... our waiter Dylan didn't even ask how we were doing  and since I wasn't really eating my burger he decided to take it without even asking me ..really rude n unacceptable . Coming back to this place is something I might not ever do .

*WORST RED ROBIN EXPERIENCE EVER* I am an avid fan of Red Robin, and I really enjoy the food and service of most Red Robin's I visit. I am giving a 3 star rating cause this only happened once out of the many times I have come here after the incident occurred. Which they have been absolutely terrific, and amazing since, plus, I have not seen this server since the incident so I am hoping he was fired or something. This is what happened:  Now every server I get at this location is great and very friendly, except for one. We were seated in a booth closer to the bar, and at first had a pretty decent server. He took our drink orders and when he came back to take our food orders, he was EXTREMELY rude to only me but not to my father or boyfriend(Sexist?).  Here is how it went down: He looked at my father first and said "Hey man what can I get you, Sir?" of course being very friendly, then my boyfriend saying "alright boss, your turn. What can I get you?"  Then it was my turn.  He will barely even looked me in the eye and said "what do you want?"  I turned and said "I would like the crispy chicken sal-" he cuts me off and said "what dressing?" I turn and say "may I please have 2 cups of Italian Dressing, oh and please no bacon on the sal-" he cuts me off, says "K" turns to my father and boyfriend and says "your food will be here shortly guys" ignores me and leaves. Now, I have religious beliefs that prevent me from eating bacon and the salad I was ordering had bacon on it, so I was hopeful that he understood that I didn't want it on the salad.  About 10 minutes later the food is here. However I had a HUGE scoop of bacon right on top of the salad. I tell him I asked for no bacon, again he made no eye contact and he just grabbed my plate and walked away. I get my salad back, with no bacon. Finally. I ate my salad. All was fine. Until I needed a drink refill. I said I would like Diet Coke. He leaves and then he brings Sprite. I said Diet Coke. He leaves and brings Dr. Pepper. I said Diet Coke. He leaves and after 10min I realize he isn't bringing me a Diet Coke. I go to the hostess who was glad to get me my actual order.  After all of this. We were set to leave. When my father requests to speak with the manager and reported his horrible behavior. He was rude, mean and a just a mega jerk!!!  Luckily I haven't seen him since.

We were at Red Robin this past Saturday..Looked forward for the Burgers they are sponsoring on TV ($6.99 Tavern) which also shows on there site..When arriving they said the price went up to $7.99.. Every additional toppings will be extra about $1.00 (sorry, can't clearly remember). I was afraid almost to ask our waiter for things needed around our table, about the menu.. etc..because he seems he was getting bothered..I had to explain to him this is our first time coming. The good review about Red Robin was the food, it was delicious..Can't beat that endless fries.

Decent burgers, fries, and milkshakes. I came here at about 9PM, an hour before closing. The restaurant was quite empty so the service was very quick. I came with my sister and we split a burger and milkshake. We ordered: Whiskey River BBQ Burger with bottomless fries:  The burger was tasty but was cooked a little too well (we ordered medium, it came out well done). My sister and I have lighter appetites, so this was the perfect size to share. Nana-Nana Moo-Moo Classic Milkshake:  This is a banana and chocolate milkshake. They use artificial banana flavoring which is a bit too sweet for my taste. While the restaurant looks a bit run down, it was generally clean, including the bathrooms. If you're looking for a quick bite after the mall closes, this is a good spot.

The wait here is pretty long not to be seated but to be served and actually get your meal. I eat here more than I actually want to because William likes coming here so I have to go with him ... I'm pretty familiar with the menu already. Your typical burgers, shakes and fries which there are better joints to go to. All in all, I give them 3 stars.  Tip! They just updated their menu with the new ramen burger $12.49 .... Maybe I would like the taste of it if it wasn't so expensive haha.

Is it me or did the burgers get smaller? Did the fries get well smaller in portion! I have to ask for more often than I usually do. Two would be cool but lately it's three request! Quick sitting and no wait even though it looks busy. I can't believe grilled onions you have to pay extra! It's part of the veggie section why do you have to pay? Kids spaghetti seems pretty dry this time around. Greedy smurf on the marinara sauce.  Bathroom seems to be messy now and not well stocked.  The staff is always great!

We received outstanding service today from Sean in Glendale. He had several tables as it was lunch time but he greeted everyone and checked in to make timely refills  and make sure everyone had a great dining experience. We enjoyed our lunch. Thank you Sean!!!!

Our waitress was lovely and we were seated quickly, but the food was dreadful!  I'm a vegetarian and Red Robin doesn't offer much in terms of meat-free choices (even the salads have meat). I decided to get the grilled cheese, but it was the worst grilled cheese I have ever had. It seemed like they left the sandwich sitting on the grill for too long on one side, it was thick with burned, greasy cheese. This made it really crunchy and hard to eat. My sister got the clucks and fries and said the chicken nuggets she makes at home are much better, and she makes those in the microwave.  Just skip this place.
Service was great but the food wasn't as good as people claim it is. The fries serving size was small it was annoying. We had to ask for a lot of fries at the end of the day for two people.

Service was good, but we saw a giant cockroach run across the floor and climb up someone's table. They didn't even comp their meal or clean the table after the busboy killed the roach.  Bottom line: this place is dirty and has roaches. The burgers are just okay.

I'm giving it a 2 star not because of the food but overall experience! It seems like you have to beg to get more fries !! For your unlimited bottomless fries!! And they take for ever to bring it out ! And the attitude you get when you ask it's like your bothering them !  I am not at all impressed with this place! Food was good but why return to a place with attitude! And expensive! Might as well go to local dinner or farmer  boys !

Came in on a Saturday night and the extra long wait time from being seated, ordering drinks and food, and getting our food out. The waiter we got stuck with was all over the place (under staffed clearly). He was running back and forth tending to his other tables (who sounded super high maintenance). It's been awhile since I have been to this Red Robin, but this is the first time it's been a sub-par experience.

I went for the $6.99 special that came on T.V. and  their website and when I got there it was $7.99.  Now I know it's just  $1.00 but I don't like false advertising.  The burger was good and the bottomless fries too,  but the cadillac margarita was not as good.  When I tried it I notice something was missing and it was gone in two sips because it had sooooo much ice.  When I asked the waiter is this a cadillac??? she said no it's the house margarita and apologize for her mistake and gladly gave me my cadillac at no extra charge.  I told her no salt on the rim and when I tasted it I could taste salt IN the drink.  The cadillac tasted the same as the house margarita but in a different cup REALLY!!!  I might as well ordered a salty lemonade.

An update to my review below. I had a talk with the manager his name is SHERWIN. he is super nice and understandable. He apologized for the inconvenience that had happened and he offered us either a 25$ gift card or our money back in which we decided to get a refund. He also put the reward that BIANCA had used back on my account so now i had a chance to get my 10th burger for free. He also explained to us how the rewards program works. He was very nice and i had to give only the managers work and the way he handled this situation was 5 starts . He also said he will have a talk with BIANCA. But its kind of unfortunate that we had to have a talk with tha manager instead of just the waitress doing her job This place used to be good. First i wanted a 2 for 15$ deal that they have and then i asked for a birthday burger since it was my birthday. The waitress her name is BIANCA FI and she was very rude. First she didnt even understand what I wanted then she was like you cant get a 2 for 15$ deal with a b day burger. Then she told us it will be cheaper if we just get a burger and appetizer. We said ok just to later discover she had put our 10th burger instead of our b day burger for free. How funny that our total came out literally equal to the 15$ deal like 1$ cheaper. Over all she didnt give us the b day burger and didnt even check to tell us we didnt have the burger for free. She was over all very rude didnt know how to do her job and although we tipped her she didnt know how to do her job. DEFINITELY NOT GOING

I love Red Robin. This location is probably the closest to me. Therefore I tend to come when I'm craving a juicy burger. Today was a different occasion though. We came in to satisfy mom's craving and celebrate my mom's birthday. We were seated in less than 10 minutes. Our server seemed really nice but quite stressed. While eating I noticed his manager or superior getting mad at him and talking to him without taking him to the back. It was very obvious and we felt really bad. Half way through dinner I mentioned to my server that it was moms birthday if they could sing to her. He agreed in a nicely matter. He took quite a bit to come by but it didn't bother us. He then came to us and brought my mother her little complimentary dessert and apologized because his coworkers didn't want to sing along with him. I felt really bad for him. I think it all had to do with his manager and that incident. This was very disappointing because incidents behind the dining area shouldn't affect customers. I don't blame our server. I blame his manager for not handling the situation in a proper matter. Will I visit this location again? I don't know. Maybe not.

Five stars for Juan (C.? I think that was his last name initial on his name tag). Give him a raise, give him a promotion, give him whatever days off he wants. He works so hard and is the best server I've ever had. Seriously y'all.
I really enjoyed my food here more than other Red Robin's. atmosphere is great and the staff is beyond polite and professional. Will be back!!

No diss to the service, but I've never had a good burger here. I just ordered the Mac n cheese tavern burger, which was at best a McDonald's patty with cold Macaroni - hardly any cheese present.  Could not be more disappointed with the quality of the food.

Very great place to grab a burger and walk it off in the mall. I really enjoyed my ROYAL RED ROBIN Burger and bottomless strawberry lemonade. Great service provided by our waiter ERIC always check in on is made sure we were good.... really enjoyed my over all experience

I don't get it... I unfortunately didn't read the reviews cause we were starving and we had the kids with us, so we needed a place where they have high chairs, kids menu... They had exactly that.  The girl in the front was a bit bland, but warmed up after talking to her.  They had us wait about 10 mins and seated us.  They put us in a booth which didn't work with us very well.  Then we saw a table open and we switched... That threw a huge wrench in their system lol.  We got our order our food and got it pretty quick.  The food was really good!  The server was really nice but I think they were so busy that they didn't pay too much attention to us.  That didn't bother me too much though.  Their payment tablet thing is pretty awesome!  It allows you to do everything right t your table.  It saves a huge hassle of dealing with the waiter/waitress and going back and forth, waiting to get your change/card back, Etc.   I am not sure why ppl give this place bad reviews, but for the most part we enjoyed our lunch, even though there was a million ppl inside, it somehow was still enjoyable.  I would recommend trying it out.  Hopefully your experience will be as good as mine!!

Ashley our waitress didn't make our experience want to relive it ... sorry but she was rude and little friendly in the standard questions. The food: Whiskey River Bbq Burger was so greasy that the bottom bun was soggy with grease ... disgusting. Blta Croissant was ice cold, tomatoes and bacon partially frozen ... no gourmet experience at all. Then we got Smoke & Pepper patty was very watery and the garlic fries loveless. The Southern Charm Burger was the only one that was fine. No matter of the expirience we gave a tip ... I really hope you guys start improving or it was it with red robin in glendale galleria.

From start to end I was utterly disappointed. First, we couldn't tell if this was open seating or someone would seat us. Then, the ziosk machines were confusing in terms of ordering (apparently some items can be ordered there and others require a server) and didn't print us a receipt. When we got our appetizer  (pretzel bites are dry and the cheese is gross) the plate I got was unclean. The all American patty melt was nothing special (or even okay). Even my bf's bloody mary was extremely watery and salty. The only saving grace was the fries (with the help of ketchup and seasoning). Summary: bad to no service due to ziosk machines and horribly subpar food/drink. Go to another location or make it at home.

I never come to red robin often enough, then again I'm glad I don't because every time I come here their food is amazing! came to red robin tonight with my family and ordered the chili chili burger. yes- chili chili twice!  the burger was very tasty and instead of just regular fries I ordered sweet potato!  asked for their curry ketchup which makes a perfect fit with the fries! I give this place and their customer service an A+!

Visited on 3-18-17 (Red Robin in Glendale Galleria mall) Came here for a relatively quick sit down lunch around 1pm Was sat at a table promptly, the young lady who directed me was pleasant The young gentleman waiter was courteous, attentive and helpful Ordered the Southwest Sombrero Salad    - asked for no onions and no cheese     - dressing, jalapeno coins, and jalapeno spread on the side Salad came out about 7-10 min later, they forgot to take the onions out but it wasn't that big of a deal I'm glad I asked for the jalapeno coins and spread on the side, didn't care for either of them The rest of the salad was decent, favorite part was how the chicken was cooked (ancho-grilled)  If you're really hungry, I would add extra chicken but the portion I was given was pretty standard. All in all, a good experience, haven't had a bad experience at Red Robin yet :)

Everywhere they are advertising the $6.99 Burger.. Nope it is $7.99 here.  I even got an menu that said the burger was $6.99, the other two people got an menu that said it was $7.99.  The waitress explained that the $6.99 is not at all places.. OK, then we got our food.  It was ok at best.  Two of the the people got the burgers and one got the grilled cheese.   One of the three of us loves this place, after eating then, not so much.  Too bad, we drove awhile just to get there.  By the way there was even one of the billboards advertising the $6.99 burger in Studio City.  The closest place seems to the Glendale Galleria.  Not good advertising.
I've never had a bad meal here. The service is great too. I just luv it! I have nothing bad to say at all =)

This one goes out to the customer service for sure !!! COLIN.... my waiter was amazing... on time attentive... empathetic....funny..... Gorgeous..... (hot)... i wish i could rob him and take him to work for me... he was on it the entire time .. he really was great!!! The food i was disappointed with but didnt make an issue because the service was outstanding... and that is so rare these days that it was great going somewhere and being taken care of...thanks collin...

Good solid burgers. Love the new tavern burgers cause the are more my size I like the spicy burgers, the guac burger, the BBQ whiskey burger. Salads are not worth the $ The milkshake is my favorite part with the bottomless fries.  The restaurant is a good size, I'm always seated pretty quick. You can't always get phone service in parts of the restaurant. They now have iPad things on the table so you can pay there and not wait for your waiter to come back. Makes it speedy, I like it.

I have been to quite a few Red Robins all over California and I have to say I have never had better customer service and service in general than from Denise at this Red Robin. I am only in Glendale for work and have gone twice (February & April) and she happened to be my server both times. She remember myself, and my friend. She is even commented that we were missing a friend who wasn't with us this but was last time. She is super patient, friendly and very welcoming. She gave us information about the upcoming changes to the Red Robin decor and even helped my friend sign up for the Rewards program.  If I ever come back to Glendale, and go to Red Robin, I will ask to sit in her section because she is a fantastic server.

Came to Red Robin cause they have gluten free and vegetarian options..worst experience..don't even want to give them a star.. order from gluten free menu Burning love burger protein style (lettuce wrap) No jalapeño coins Vegetarian patty Got: Burger in bun Send it back Got: Burger with jalapeno coins Took 30 minutes to get my order right
I think their mix drink are awesome. Personal favorite Golden Margarita on rocks! Food wise they are known for their burgers

RedRobin...YUMMMMMMMM Tavern burgers and endless fries got me all wanting more.  Clean.  Funny wall art. Nice staff . Easy pay at table. And even ordering... but yea I like talking to humans. So we waiting for our server. Lol.  I'm not a bug fan of chains, but those place kinda rocks if you're craving a great burger at a low cost.

I live in Americana and almost every second day I'm in Glendale galleria and never went there. We decided after late evening shopping come and try this place yesterday.  *This place it's very big so other customers don't bother you and have plenty of seats to chose from.Everything looks so clean  and service really fast.  *Self pay machine makes process of payment faster and already have amounts of tip to chose so you don't need to count by yourself. * food is yummy!!! I took chicken tenders with fries! I love their potatoes and portion was so big that I took some home.  I'll be back!!!

I wanted a casual, not crowded place to sit at a bar with a decent cocktail and have a burger.  This was exactly what I got!  Even better because the bartender was good at making drinks, personable and friendly.  Bottomless fries? They were great, but I have no will power so had way more than I ever would have had. The burger was good, very filling.  The Mai Tais were tasty, not too strong but not weak either. I didn't get the bartender's name, but he's fairly new to LA from Wisconsin. He's what made this a 5-star visit.
Closed! We went there the other night and it's completely barricaded. No signage indicating whether or not it's reopening.
They are closed now. I had a bad experience last time I went there. The fish and chips were awful.  Service in the bar was usually bad

I just got an email from RR that they are closing this location Sunday.  On the one hand, this is a shame as this is the closest RR to me.  On the other hand, this never was the best location of theirs.  Guess I'll be going to Northridge.

So I must start by saying that I'm a true fan of Red Robin however; this location needs to get it together. We got there and the hostess said "hello how many and sorry but it'll be about 15 minutes because we need some tables to be cleaned up". Ok I said! Then we sat down ad realized they're basically short staffed. I'll give them a chance, no need to judge right? Well this was not the case when I got my food. I tried to be fair but my food was over cooked and dry. Burgers are the specialty right? They should know how to cook burgers! And the fries were overly done. Hard and dry! Even the extra order! Ugh I was so dissatisfied! Most likely this will be my last time here. I'd rather go to Santa Anita. They always rock there. Btw- the server was very slow. It took him so long just to ask if we needed anything else! Really????

I'm here at this Red Robin for the first time, and I just finished lunch as I write these words. I'm here on yelp just to say that our waiter Juan was phenomenal. The man was so enthusiastic and quick, and he deserves the highest commendation. It's always super encouraging to see servers work so diligently, so I try to make sure they can get recognized for their exemplary labors.  Thank you Juan! You single-handedly made this Red Robin worth coming to over and over again!

Me and my boyfriend had such a wonderful time here for dinner. This place is known for their hamburgers and boy oh boy they were so tasty!!! They have their own special seasoning on the table and that is also the BEST. Overall, very clean, very tasty and very friendly.
This place Is just ok. Took about 45 min to get our burger, which we requested medium rare. It came out fully cooked, but the initial wait was so long that we didn't feel like waiting for a new one.

I'm giving 3 stars for this place. My reasoning being: 1) the hostess (Suzanna) is really unwelcoming. 2) food is oily  We arrived at the restaurant and Suzanna was talking away with another co worker. we waited about 10 minutes and we were not helped. Finally we decided to just sit at an open booth. we didnt know if we were to seat ourselves, or wait for this chick to finish her long conversation, but we got tired of standing around. so we sit at a booth, we are a table of 2. she sees us, walks over, and rudely remarks "what are you doing, you need to wait to be seated". we politely explain, we thought we seat ourselves because---and she immediately cut us off and didnt let us finish the reasoning why we sat ourselves. anyways she proceeds to find us a table, it takes about 3-4 minutes. she was just really rude and unwelcoming. Red Robin- you are lucky I was starving or I would have taken my business elsewhere. The wait time for the food wasn't bad, and the server we had was actually quite nice and helpful. I wish I could remember her name, unfortunately I can't. The food was good. The wings were pretty tasty, and the burgers were great, just a tad on the oily side. I thought that the garlic fries would be good, but they weren't. They're drenched in this oil that tastes like garlic, but the oil is too much and its just overwhelming. the whiskey BBQ burger is really tasty though. also, the smoke and pepper burger was wonderful. we also had an order of the spinach and artichoke dip. its pretty basic, same as everywhere else that you go and order that appetizer.  Other than Suzanna, we had a good experience here.

Haven't been to Red Robin in a while and decided to come here while shopping at Glendale Galleria. Place is big compared to the location in Arcadia. You'll notice the screens where they show games which is nice. You're also able to view menu and play games at your table for a cost. We were seated right away in a booth and after getting seated and presented with menus, we waited for about 10-15 mins before we were approached for help? She said she was filling in while our waiter was on break. Still, the service could've been faster. We ordered our water and food at the same time since we waited a while. Finally got our food. I had ordered their Billionaire Burger which came with a potato in the burger and supposedly melted cheese, tomatoes, lettuce. I asked for a medium well. Burger came out and nothing like the picture. Cheese was barely melted and the meat was more rare than anything. It was hard looking for our waiter since I was never asked for a water refill. I just went ahead and ate it. I like the bottomless fries but the fries though they were steak fries were really dry. I love burgers but the service and food needs to be better. I liked Red Robin back then but times have changed.

Outstanding Customer Service by Steve the Manager and David the Assistant.... Food was great, but the service is amazing!!! Could not ask for any better from a chain establishment.  The personal care displayed by the General Manager Steve is 5 Star Worthy and will keep us coming back even though I pass 3 other locations on the way to this Red Robin.  It's all about service and I don't mind driving for it!!! Highly recommend this location.

During the week it's a lot dirty. It seems like there's no busboy or dishwasher. The happy hour wine is okay. The hamburgers are always great. But so disappointing compared to someplace like Santa Maria.

Burger is decent but I still rather go to five guys for cheaper. Either way still good but service is terrible. Place was not busy but food took forever and waiter kept forgetting about our orders.  When it's this slow and service is this bad. It just comes down to incompetency of staff. Are there burgers good enough to take another chance at this Place? Probably not.

5-stars for the incredible service that we received from Robert! My boyfriend and I agreed that this was the best service we've ever had at any Red Robin restaurant. He was very attentive and friendly throughout our meal. We were pleasantly surprised when he brought us 2 baskets of endless fries right after he took our order. It's rare for Red Robin servers to give those endless fries before your entree comes out. He truly went above and beyond to give us an enjoyable dining experience. We'll definitely be coming back to this location when we have our Red Robin burger cravings.

Visited 3/6/2016 After almost a year, you would think things would have improved.  I'm disappointed to say that it hasn't improved.  They were busy, but they seemed to get the customers waiting for a table fairly quickly to a table.  Maybe that was my first mistake.  Maybe you get faster service if you ask for a table.  I ordered a simple burger from Giselle to go at 5:00 PM, but it took over half an hour to get it!  I had to ask someone for assistance as to why it was taking so long because I wasn't able to find Giselle.   I can't help notice though that maybe this is the norm?  This happened to me about a year ago.  Same situation ( to go and it was a free burger).   Disappointing....... Thank goodness this year the burger tasted better than last year!!

My family and I came here last night because it was National Cheeseburger Day! What better place to get a burger with bottomless fries. YUM. Anyways, we stood at the hostess stand forever without any acknowledgment. So we walked into the large "bar area" where 95% seating was open, and was told we couldn't sit there because my son is too young.  Another 3 min. to be seated at a table next to the bar area, and another 5 min. before our waiter came over to greet us. I'm hangry at this point. They were definitely understaffed, and manager looked like he just graduated high school and hired all of his friends.  Customer service is lacking at this location.  Our waiter, Eli, did his best to serve his area but we could tell he (and other staff) were overwhelmed.  Not his fault.  Standards Red Robin, standards.

I called ahead and asked to reserve a table for my large group (8 hungry Girl Scouts and 4 hungry mamas). The hostess said they don't take reservations. It would try to keep a larger table open for us. So it was a gamble. We got there 30 minutes later and within 3-5 minutes we were seated and taken care of

I feel like with Red Robin the food is usually really good. It all comes down to who your waitress/waiter is. That can make or break the food experience. I love all the sauce choices and the fact that they can turn any item on the menu into a vegetarian option! They are so extremely accommodating! The food gets a HUGE smile everytime! the sauces and bottom less fries do as well! only down side is sometimes you walk in and no one is there to greet you and you are just standing there staring at the empty host spot like hellooo? Anyways I recommend this location the positive is much higher than the negatives for me. For dessert you have to try that massive ice cream pie!! OMG!! you have chocolate ice cream, whip cream, cookies and cream ice cream with cookie crumbles. TO DIE FOR!!! definitely for two or even three people! You're welcome! haha!

Be aware of the entertainment fee on the computers they put on the tables. The wait staff will tell you it says it will charge your account a $2 when you start playing the games. But it doesn't!  I took a picture of it and reported it to the corporate office. Still waiting to hear back from the manager, Aaron, at this location. I left a message with one of his staff members last week and never heard back. They are always running out of glasses at this place.  Buy some more!

Im not sure why I'm giving 2 stars. Based on my last experience, probably not worth that. What's the point of having bottomless fries when they don't bring you fries when you ask for them? Bottomless bullshit. Service was slower than slow.  I'm guessing the waitress forgot. That's the only thing that makes sense. When the offer is for bottomless fries, have those ready at the drop of a dime.  Will I return to this location? NO!

We waited on the side door entrance no one came up to us until I waved down 2! Employees one of them finally had the "host" come over and sit us down. We waited 16-20 minutes for our burgers 2 burgers, the waiter finally came over said it was going to be 5 more minutes his excuse was they had just got in a huge order of 25 burgers to go. That shouldn't be a reason my burgers should still be able to come out on time! So many dirty tables no one comes out to clean them. At one point guest were sitting themselves. Horrible customer service I will not be coming back. Where is the manager!!!
I tried the new signature burger, but it honestly wasn't worth the price. Like, the burger was good overall, I just wouldn't pay  $14 for it.

My boyfriend and I were looking for a place to eat. He was a little hesitant to go because the fries take forever for a refill, but I convinced him, it was at that location and not this one.  We waited about 5 minutes, by the mall entrance, to have someone acknowledge us.  As we were waiting for 5 minutes, I was able to take a look around and found many tables not cleared up.  Probably half the main dining room was dirty. I've also made eye contact with two other ladies that did not approach us nor acknowledge that we were waiting to be seated. The gentleman that acknowledged us said he will be right with us after he helps someone.  We saw this gentleman hold a remote and went directly to a tv to change channels. He didn't find the channel, and told the people he was helping with he will be back. He ran away and completely forgot about us. That is when we decided to go elsewhere. Don't go here unless you don't mind waiting for horrible customer service. We found this experience rude and very unprofessional.

Decided to treat my son here since he tagged along with me at the Galleria to help me get some raffle tickets for some shoes.  I've only been to this particular location once before and I don't even remember it.      So the reason why this establishment got 5 stars from me is because 1) The server Ryan was AWESOME SAUCE!!! and 2) BOTTOMLESS SWEET POTATO FRIES!!!  I was in heaven, hahaha.        My son got the ghostfire red tavern burger.  He said it was pretty spicy, but delicious.  He also got bottomless garlic fries.  He totally loved that.  He got 3  1/2 orders of it, haha.  I can't blame him.     I got a Red Tavern double with a lettuce wrap and bottomless sweet potato fries.  They were good, so good that I ordered 4 more of them.  Lol.  Our server was more than happy to replenish our bottomless fries and even on the third time asking, he brought each of us an extra order just in case.  Thaaaaank you!!!  The burger was good, small, but still good.  It was also cheap.  The bill in total came out to be less than $20, not including tip.        Hopefully the next time I dine here, Ryan is my server.  He was just that fantastic!

Terrible place. Waiter sucked didn't even crack a smile or ask if everything was ok. The food wasn't even good burger was burned. Almost everything came out late and we would have to ask another waitress to get are food out for us. I will probably never come back worst experience ever

Steak fries lovers, come here! You get them with your burgers, and they're BOTTOMLESS! Well, the container they put them in doesn't have a bottom, but the important part is that you can eat as many of these beautiful steak fries as you want.  I started coming here often after my daughter fell in love with her kids meal: corn dog, mandarin oranges, and chocolate milk. Whenever we're at the Glendale Galleria, she would request to eat here, and each time we do, we've never had a horrible experience. My biggest complaint is that there is no reception here (I'm on Verizon).  Their burgers are good. I've had their: Regular Red Robin Burger/Keep it Simple - simple. Not really special, as it's your typical burger that you can get at most burger joints.  Red's Double Tavern Burger - close to their regular, but with 2 patties/cheese. Their tavern sauce is similar to thousand island.  They also have a burger with 2 patties that's a dollar cheaper than their regular burger, but the double patties burger is smaller than their regular.  Royal Red Robin - the burger with the egg on top. If you like runny yolk, then yum! Burning Love - their burger with jalapenos, on jalapeno roll and such. I wish it was more spicy, but it's a good choice. Bonzai - yum yum. I love teriyaki and pineapple. This is one of my faves.  Guacamole bacon - typical California burger. It's great with chicken.  They have a variety of sauces you can get, and some of them are at no additional cost. I love dipping my fries in their Thai chili sauce, and the financee/bf loves dipping them in the tavern sauce. Free sauce! Better than McDonalds charging for extra charges, ha.  Feel free to customize your orders. You can opt out of fries and get something healthier, such as broccoli or fruit, but not all sides are bottomless/unlimited as the fries are.  The people that work here are very nice. We were able to get seated promptly each time, and none of our food came out wrong. They did forget my daughter's chocolate milk a couple times, but no biggie. Even those are bottomless.

Me and my wife ordered the BBQ chicken wrap and it was out right terribly made. First the chicken did not taste good but the sandwhich was not good. All the chicken was in beginning  and the rest of the ingredients including the BBQ sauce was at the end of each sandwhich. It was like eating chicken and bread then lettuce, BBQ, and bread. Fries were okay.

The drink was great. A virgin Pina colada. Mmmm. The onion rings with campfire sauce.... BOMB. But I hated the fries last time I came,  I thought they were having a bad day.... Had the fries again today... Wood chips with salt and pepper. Hamburger 2 small parties smushed together that were like Luke warm....Do they make shitty fries so you'll up-sale?  I'd skip the regular fries for sure.  Unlimited fries are more of a threat than a treat. The waiter was very sweet though.

The location is just inside the Glendale mall.  Because the location gets so much foot traffic, it's a bit worn out.  The bathroom was a complete mess and features graffiti - not ideal! The service was good, thanks William!  I was a little let down with the seasonal wild pacific crab cake burger.  It came out looking nothing like the picture, and it was super greasy.  The taste was just OK, I should have gone with one of their popular burgers. My kids had the spaghetti, which they said was good.  BUT, the blended fruit drink came out with too many big ice chunks, they both complained about the consistency.  The location has televisions and good beer options.  It also has a fun eclectic vibe, my kids enjoyed walking around and looking at all the pictures and 'things' on the walls.   Overall, I felt like the location missed the target, I've had much better experiences at other Red Robin locations.  Sorry to report.

After a long day of holiday shopping, clucks & fries and a beer hit the spot. The only problem with this restaurant is that science can't clone the server Juan. If I owned a restaurant, I'd pay this guy whatever it took to come work for me. Good food, amazing service. No complaints. Red Robin, yummmmmm.
Waitress was nice but service was slow. Place is just sort of run down. Sticky menus. No air conditioning. Crowded and awkward table layout. We regretted choosing this place.
Service is always good here in the Galleria.  Beer fair priced on domestic, other a bit over priced.  Hummus is awesome so is the vegan patty.

Always good service. Unlimited steak fries refills with burger orders. I like their seasoning salt in my fries. It can be found on the table condiments. Their milkshakes are pretty good also. They have a little tablet on the table where you can call for your waiter / waitress or if you want to ask for the paycheck. You can pay through the tablet also. It will also print your receipt if you want! Just be careful to read what you type because they charge for the games you can play on it.

My family and I visited Red Robin on 3-12-17, and we had the worst possible experience. We visit this location pretty often, but after this visit I do not think we will return. I usually do not like to name individuals, but unfortunately it was the people that made it horrible for us. Our waitress Giselle seemed to lack the skills needed to waiter, she wouldn't pay attention nor would she write down the order to be able to deliver it correctly. We asked for two cocktails, we received a margarita over ice when we initially asked for a blended one, then when she took that back they just blended it not considering the ratio between the alcohol strawberry and ice(water). This left the drink absolutely diluted in water. Same with the second drink, the coke was so much it couldn't be considered a cocktail.  After we ordered, it took around 40 minutes for the food to be served, one of the entrees was a burger which was requested to have the bun "double/triple toasted"(exact words used) for it to be crispy, it was delivered with a bun not toasted at all. A salad we requested to have iceberg lettuce not romaine lettuce was delivered with romaine, even though our waitress assured us she would allow the cooks to know. [Understand the requests we made are due to health reasons, even though that should not matter] We made our concerns and complaints known to the individuals helping us. This led to the manager taking over, she too was unprofessional and rude. She basically explained that the salads are not fresh and are tossed out of a bag into a plate that they could not replace the lettuce, instead she gave us the opportunity to choose another salad, which we did... during this time to wait another random waiter.. came to take the burger with the non toasted bun away to replace it with the salad we just ordered. This was even worse because it goes to show the team lacks communication. The salad was replacing a salad, not the burger!!!!! We asked for the manager's name but we were never answered. Honestly, we are at a loss for words when it comes to describing how horrible our visit here was.

Came during the week and there was not much of a crowd. We were seated quickly, but the sever did a very poor job getting our order out. We ordered an appetizer that came at the same time as our meal. The one star is for the manager on site, he went above and beyond to fix things. It's unfortunate that we needed the manager to come in and bring out our order and apologize, the restaurant wasn't even busy and there were a few tables who came way after us but got their food at the same time as us.  meh, skip!
Food is good for the most part but sometimes the service is really bad. I would rather drive to San dimas and eat at that red robin honestly.

First time at this location and I have to say this wasn't the best. I went to the one at South Bay Galleria and had an amazing experience. Our server here was nice and welcoming. But when I asked for sweet potato fries I got regular instead, which I was fine with. I just asked for an order of sweet potatoes. But the thing that irked me was waiting almost 15 for them. It wasn't busy whatsoever and I know it doesn't take that long to drop fries. The billion dollar baby was pretty good though. Overall I don't think I'd return. Definitely would go to Shake Shack next time.

It takes a lot for me to simply mark a one star review for a restaurant but honestly, if I could I would give it no stars. There's a considerable amount wrong with the Galleria Red Robin and I'll try my best to highlight specifics. Red Robin is usually just meant for me as a last resort. I used to go to the Fresno Red Robin all the time as a "fancy sit down" meal option in high school. The service is always an average to skimming below average at the Fresno/Clovis Red Robins. Food quality wise, I always order the pineapple teriyaki burger and the last few times I went, the bun was drenched in teriyaki that it was impossible to hold together. This was the same story at the Galleria Red Robin too, maybe there's a flaw in the recipe or the mere stacking of the burger itself. But I digress, I went here a couple days before Christmas because I had relatives from out of town in LA that wanted to eat close-by in Glendale for my mother's birthday. Considering it was the holidays, my family wasn't prepared for the 2 hour waits in restaurants around the area near the Americana. The only option was a seemingly smaller wait time at the Galleria Red Robin but I was sorely, sorely mistaken. I'm not sure where to begin about my experience here.  First, in summary, the hostess was incredibly rude. An odd vibe lingered around her similar to an air of ill-precieved self-appointed superiority from the hostess to over all the various families with their different party numbers, waiting to be seated in a hunger induced dazed after possibly skipping lunch. These families were ultimately at the mercy of the hostess and she abused that power by attempting to seat different families ahead of families that came before those seated. It was not only annoying to see those before my own family who were waiting a lot longer get passed up with a family of similar party size needing to be seated.   Second, after standing for the first 30 minutes and watching the families be seated first. I began to notice the way that certain parties were seated. You know that game Diner Dash and how the 2 party characters will typically be seated in a 2 party booth to get bonus points or something like that? If so or if not, the point is that there were just 2 people taking up a booth capable of holding a party of 8. The lack of... I guess what could it be referred to? Table seating strategy? Whatever it is, it was the same story. Big booths holding just 2 people where there were little tables throughout the restaurant that could have easily accommodated the much smaller 2 people party sizes.  I stayed optimistic. Maybe my impression of the Galleria Red Robin had gotten off to an bad start. Then another 30 minutes passed and another... about an 1 and a half into my wait time, I began to observe a little more about the function of this Red Robin. The tables that sat the parties of 2 began to clear and I anticipated having the my family's party of 7-8 people to be sat. Another 30 minutes pass and we've hit the 2 hour wait time. The tables weren't cleared off and the dirty dishes sat there as another 20-30 minutes were tacked on until a table cleaner? Busboy? I'm not sure what to call the staff member that clears off tables. He finally cleared off the tables in a very agitated, purposely slow manner, throwing a few annoyed huffs there and side glances here to the families waiting outside the area. Third, the manager had to intervene. In hopes that the management intervening would fast-track our wait time, once again... we were mistaken. Another 15 minutes tacked onto our wait time. My mother had to take a more assertive tone in requesting a table. We get sat down. The server has noticed the "trouble" we've caused the management and hostess. Proceed to eat in an awkward vibe that comes with also having your waiter throw really off-putting attitude towards everyone by having her take a really abrasive tone when answering questions and placing orders. We get our meals after 40 mins. Get the check done in another 20 and by the time we were out, it was really late at night. Somewhere after 9. It was one of the most single-handedly weird and awful dining experiences I've ever had in my life. But please, for those who've made it this far in my review. I don't want you to think that my family are those people that purposely cause disruptions in restaurants and will seek out to make any restaurant staff member's life, while serving us, a living hell. It's never been like that. They're actually incredibly patient and thoroughly enjoy leaving huge holiday tips because they all understand what it's like to have to deal with customers. However, keep in mind the potential quality of service you might receive here at this particular Red Robins in the Glendale Galleria.  Use this information wisely.

Great customer service by Alejandra! She was really polite. I ordered a milkshake and a burger to go and told her I will be back and she had them make it when I went to pick up my food so it wouldn't melt! How kind was that! You don't see great service like this often. Will definitely come back! :)

Since I live walking distance to the mall I find myself here when in need of a good burger and fries fix.  It's not necessarily known for being fancy or gourmet but usually hits the spot just fine. Yesterday 7/13 was just a big miss.  The onion bun I always get was unsually hard. It was strange and off putting. It felt like maybe it was stale, someone zapped it in the microwave for a few seconds and then maybe forgot about it. By the time it reached me it was rock solid. Like I jabbed it with a fork and the fork got stuck. It had the consistency of a thick cracker.  I also always ask for my fries extra crispy and usually they come out perfect as requested. Yesterday I found a nearly raw fry in my order, very limp and undercooked and the opposite of what I asked for.  Usually I'd get an extra helping but was so put off by the meal I didn't bother.  Our server was fine if a bit over worked. I almost complained but did not want to bother him.   We initially came in that night because of a free dessert with purchase special.  Then our dessert (a lemon cake) came out frozen. Kind of a fail. We used to come here pretty often but I'm just not so sure I'll be back after this.

So, I am here at Red Robbins right now and I will say, my server is AMAZINGLY nice, funny, kind but over worked. However, he is great and keeping it together.  Food: hmmm... OK, let me say this. I am a major Red Robbins fan. Love their food. The food tonight has gross. Hard, burnt fries, ugly burgers, warm beer... I think my kids think the fries are chips. I wish I had a picture. I am aware that the food is processed and well, fake BUT I do not want it to look fake on my plate.  Lastly, the rest room. Lord help me. I thought I was ice skating, all the sliding I was doing on the floors. Flooded toilets, water all over the floor... Worst experience ever.
Excellent service and delicious food. Burgers are extra delicious especially the pineapple burger. Our server, Josh, was efficient and accommodated all my needs.
No wait time when i arrived. My food order was wrong no bacon on my burger and no ranch with my wings. I've been to other red robins and I have always loved their food. Very disappointing experience.

Taken aback by the lack of customer service at this location. Our visit started out okay; we didn't wait long to be seated and our server, ERIKA, was prompt to ask for our drink/food order. It all started going downhill once we got our food. I ordered the bruschetta chicken burger and it was inedible. The chicken inside my sandwich was chewy and rubbery. I've never had anything like it. So gross! I took it upon myself to let the server know (because she never asked) that the chicken had a rubbery texture and asked if she could sub it out for a beef patty instead. She sort of just took my plate back without really addressing the situation, which is fine because it really wasn't her fault. What struck me as odd, though, was that she never once took it upon herself to check in with our table while we waited for her to replace my rubber chicken burger. My boyfriend and I just split his burger and fries while we waited, but we eventually ran out of fries and just sat there for a few minutes with an empty plate. Our server never came by to ask if we needed more fries, nor did she stop by to ask if we needed a refill on our drinks. She actually walked right past our table a couple of times without ever acknowledging us. Eventually, my boyfriend flagged her down so that we could order more fries. By the time she came back with the fries, she had my burger with her. She sort of just dropped everything off without saying anything. The chewy chicken was never addressed and we were never, throughout our entire visit, asked if our food was okay. Not. Even. Once. I've worked at restaurants before and I know that you're supposed to check in with your tables frequently to ask how everything is tasting and to offer refills. This never happened for us. Everything was on us. We were never asked if we needed a drink refill. We were never asked if we needed more fries (they're bottomless). We were never asked how our food was tasting. We had to ask. Erika seemed completely indifferent, bored even. Pretty sure she knew we were upset, but she really couldn't care less. Maybe it was her last day and she just stopped caring? Whatever the case, we will not be back.  Do not come here. Go to Islands down the street.

I have been to this location many times. I come here when I am in Glendale, inside the mall, and after I shop I want a nice juicy burger. I am a loyalty member of Red Robin and always get emails with new deals that they are having.  Overall, Red Robin has great burgers, yummy bottomless fries, and great service. The last time I was here was with my mom, aunt and my boyfriend. I wish I remembered our servers name, because he was amazing! He kept coming to check up on us, and refilled our drinks constantly. The burger I got was too spicy and I told our server and he offered me another burger that was not spicy, and was so quick to bring it out too!  He also split our check in two separate transactions, so we can get maximum discount. And I didn't even ask him to do this! He was really nice, and attentive to us.  I will definitely be back to this location, as the service is always good, just like their food.

The Royal Burger with an extra patty was very tasty and extremely filling. I had problems with the bun (sesame), totally falling apart but being very soft and filled with all the ingredients, that is a problem I could deal with. The patties were cooked medium as that was the least they would be cooked, if you are a medium rare person you'll note the difference. All in all this would be an outstanding burger if not for the cooking limitations...... it is still a burger worth trying again and again, though!

First time coming here. The food was good the drinks were good, at a fair price... The service was decent can't complain  By far the best onion rings I've ever had , and I'm not really a fan of onion rings, tho  my gf ate most... The burger was real good and the garlic fries were even better.

Don't waste your time here. I wish I had listened to the other Yelp reviews. 5 stars for Jordan, our server. She seemed pleasant and genuine. Everything was timely from our seating, drinks, food, being checked on and asking for our bill. Everything else is below average at best. What the heck is wrong with the quality of the burger meat here? The buns were crumbling apart. The meat tasted like a generic office backyard bbq meat that had been previously frozen. Something is just off about this place. One other gripe I had was when we were seated. A party of 2 before us was sat in a long booth that could easily sit 6. We (party of 3) were sat in the back in one of the smaller booths. My husband is not a small guy (6'1", muscular build), and I had to squeeze next to him as my brother sat across from us. Whatever. I didn't want to be a bother as I saw bigger tables all around us. We ended up with Jordan, our server, and she was great.  Ending recommendation: Don't bother. Brave the line at In N Out.
Wanted to eat here but finding something to watch on the TVs was more important than seating us :(

wow. worst red robbin I've ever been to. server never came to the table. the lady that did seem to want to help is rude . food is cold currently while I eat. lettuce is saugy. he placed on order on our wings completely wrong. burger is extra crispy burnt. and the Mac n cheese in the burger was not cheesy just mac. never brought us our SECOND batch of 'bottomless fries'

ZERO STARS!!! I used to love eating here but after tonight I'm just beyond pissed. We ordered 2 fish n chip dinners at 9pm and my hubby went to pick it up. He comes back, I open the boxes to find a mess in each box. The fish looked like they were fried on low heated oil, greasy, and nasty. There were about 12 used lemon wedges sitting on top of nasty sweet potato fries. WTF! I called and the manager was just nonchalant about it. EXCUSE ME! now I'm prego, hungry and everything is closed. They want to give me a gift card, no, I want my money back, thanks! They need to get it together.

Came for dinner with my husband after work. No one greeted us so we were standing there for a while.  Once we were seated our server was quick and friendly.  Burgers were good, a little smaller than I expected but still satisfying and tasted great.  Prices seems a little high.

Been trying to make it here for a while....IM GLAD I DID! They have so many options that look good, plus they have BOTTOMLESS sides with your burger. There drinks looked and tasted good as well...we had a milkshake with a shot of liquor ;-) Service was great..even though it kinda slipped when they got busy but it was still good. Wait wasn't too bad on a busy saturday either. I will be back because this place is amazing...also not bad on the wallet at all. ps. try the Royal burger...its amazing. pss. i wish one was closer.

I used my free birthday burger (just join their club online) & was extremely satisfied. Plus you can have endless fries so that's a plus if you're especially hungry. Server (Alyssa) was great as well.

It shouldn't matter what day of the week it is. If your plan is to run a restaurant, staff it accordingly. You are in America. I shouldn't come in at 7 PM at night on a Sunday and wait 50 minutes to get a hamburger. Are you kidding? Then when you want your bottomless fries, they hesitate. It is as if the mangement wants to have their servers try to make sure not too many fries are given out, despite being bottomless. Then when you get them, they give you like 6 fries. Just stop advertising them as bottomless if you can't keep up with the cost of potatoes. Do you want a simple lesson in business?
I love the food but I'm not crazy about the service.I would love to come more often but that will not happen till the step up there game service.

I AM SO FUCKING PISSED!! I went to red Robin and ordered a vegan Boca burger. The server was awesome and very knowledgable and accommodating. I get my food, cut the burger in half and start eating. I notice what I thought was mushrooms under my grilled onions. I pulled them out because I don't like them. I keep eating. I get to the second half and find black beans, weird, I pull them out and keep eating. Henry at this point took my son to the restroom. I finish eating and then thought about how some vegans have mentioned finding meat in their food and I freeze. I think, "No, someone couldn't have possibly done that to me..." I inspect the beans and stuff I had pulled out and sure enough I found a chunk of ground beef. What. The. Fuck. Seriously?? I immediately call over the server and told him and he looked mortified!! He ran off and told a kitchen manager. He comes over and I explain and he is apologetic and says that never should have happened and that he would take it off the bill. I sit there and it just starts bugging me more and more. Henry comes back and I tell him what happened. He is instantly pissed (he's 90% vegan). As I talk to him it bugs me more and more and my server comes back and I tell him that I'm really upset because I could have been allergic to meat or something and that they don't know why I have dietary restrictions. He said he would let them know again. This time the manager comes by and I explain what happened and that its fucked up to do that to someone and that many vegans get very sick after eating meat because we don't have the enzymes to digest it anymore. He asks what he can do to make it better. And I told him I wasn't trying to get free food out of it, that I just wanted to make sure this wouldn't happen to someone else. He said that he understood and that someone was going to be leaving his kitchen. That there were only 4 guys that handled the Boca burgers and allergen section. He said whether accidental or not it was unacceptable and that they were opening an investigation. He said a manager was already on the phone with corporate in the back and that I could have the number to corporate so that I could follow up. I took the card and you better believe I'll be calling to follow up.  whether you're vegan or not it's not right to fuck with someone's food. What if I was allergic to something (like peanuts) and someone snuck it in there to be mean and I ended up having an allergic reaction and had to go to the hospital or I died?! They're being paid to cook something a particular way, not to bully someone and violate their rights! I will never be returning to red robin, I was a frequent customer but this was unacceptable. This should never have happened.

So last night I came in and I don't know what happened with last time but our service was amazing. She got our drinks on time and plus our food. One of the best waitress I have seen in awhile I didn't get her name what a shame but you knew she was there to work and not play games like some of the others ones. Different manager as well so maybe that was one of the reasons. But overall good service

Decent food. Horrible service. The server Walter messed up the drink orders, kept asking to refill it with a different drink, forgot our sauce, brought us the wrong sauces, and cut my burger open to check the temperature without asking me.  He gave us nasty looks when he thought we weren't looking after we'd asked him to correct the mistakes. In addition to being gone from the floor and pass for a 15 minute period when we needed service, he had tried lying to us to get us to order premium sauces instead of the free ones. When we asked for the menu to catch him in the lie, he sent another server to bring it to us. If anything needs to be disputed or clarified in this review, please message me.

The staff here is soooo nice, the burgers are fresh, and my favorite part is the drinks! They actually give you a nice tall glass of whatever beverage you order. I can't stand going to a restaurant where they give you a tiny glass to drink with your meal.

Super slow service. 25 mins in and no sight of my burger. Sick of looking at the pages on the menu. People are hungry you know? Im used to waiting about 15 minutes at Red Robin usually. I guess it all depends on the location. Welcome to Glendale. *Update now im at 35 mins the server comes says Ill check on your food, then goes and takes orders from 3 other tables! The restaurant isn't even busy. About time to reduce this place to 1 star?! What does everyone think?*
Home of the bottomless fries. Quick dinner option at the Glendale Galleria.   My dinner option was a chicken caesar wrap and bottomless fruit with a beer. Quick order and delivery to table.

I've always loved this Red Robin. I like that they're constantly changing up the burgers and menu items. We typically sit in the bar area to watch whatever sporting events are on. back to the their food. yeah, I really like it! I come here when it's time to blow off some steam. my favorite is the whisky river burger
The food at this Red Robin is not good and the service is worse now.I went there a lot, but not anymore. Made me sick last time I ate there.
Not as good as the one in Thousand Oaks but does the job. Servers were a little slow and the atmosphere could've been more welcoming.

This location is very small and was quite empty when we arrived... The hostess took a few minutes to acknowledge us, didn't give us a "I'll be right with you" but cool. She finally sat us and said our waiter would be right with us. The standard, right? Ok, well after waiting for a bit over 5 minutes and no waiters in sight I started losing my patience. I noticed another party arriving and a waiter attended them immediately, I asked the waiter if he could please find our waiter. His response: "I guess". Well I've had it got up, walked out, and headed over to Wood Ranch for a lovely dinner.

I'll give this place two stars instead of one because the waitress was nice.  The place was clean, but empty during lunch time.  Usually not a good sign, but we were pressed for time so we decided to give it a shot.   I ordered the bacon cheeseburger and it was terrible.  One of the worst burgers I can remember and it was $11.  For $4 I could have had In N Out which is ten times better.  The fries were big steak fries and were dry and tasteless.   I noticed as I was walking out they weren't busing the tables for the people who left.  They would let the plates sit there.  On all of the plates as I was walking out were half eaten burgers.  Looks like most people weren't even bothering to finish these terrible burgers and just paying and getting out of there to go somewhere else.

I hate to do this...  I have been going to this Red Robin for about 3 years. And the last 5 visits have been dreadful, so bad that the last visit will be the last.  It's a saturday night and they are fully staffed but there's a line of people waiting to be seated with empty tables all around us. We ended up just grabbing a table at the bar. They have these new tablets at each table that you can "order" from... except you can only order appetizers, re-order of the same bar drink, and desserts. Kind of pointless. I ordered the skinny margarita which I have had before and it was so good then. Well after sitting 10 minutes at the bar before getting delivered to my table, I get it and it's the worst margarita ever. We use the "super cool" table to call over a waitress and she comes and before I can even tell her what's wrong with it, she says "Oh it's too tart, right?"... so you KNOW this drink is bad, yet you still serve it? So I ordered a Coors light and she brings a Carona... whatever.  THEN we are waiting FOREVER for our food and the waitress brings my wrap and tells us that the printer wasn't working by the grill so the burger is going to be a while... You know because the cooks literally just thought they weren't getting any burger orders... at a burger place.  10 minutes after my food arrives, cold, his arrives not cooked the way he wanted and he said it was not good.  Honestly, this place keeps going down hill. The order of the fries get smaller and smaller and the quality of food gets worse and worse. I would not recommend this location.

My mum, her friend and I were deciding to eat at a sushi place one nice Sunday to have brunch but instead we decided to go to red robin's since it always caught my eye.  So we went and we were very excited since it was our first time. We got immediately served by a waitress and she sat us down and when we did I noticed there was a fork on the floor.  I was like ok, and we didn't think much of it.  Then the server asked what would we like, so we ordered and I wanted to try the regular fries and the garlic fries for an extra .99... We agreed. We got the fries and the regular ones were so stale and nasty. The garlic fries lacked flavor. We ordered another batch of both of them and they came back the same. We were waiting and we decided to play the free games they had on the screens, and we were unaware that they charge you $2 for games. (Always read the fine print!)  Our waitress walked by and she didn't ask if we wanted refills or napkins, as a matter of fact she didn't ask how we were doing and what we needed!!! We also had the light to signal a waitress/waiter and they all kept walking by. I eventually found the waitress and asked her if she can get me more water and when she came back, she spilled the water on me, and said oops, sorry. It got me furious and pissed off. It looked like she wanted to laugh and I had to honestly keep my cool about this. She didn't look like she wanted to work, because she was in the back just talking to an older man.  We brought this to the managers attention and a middle aged Asian lady came by to see what was going on and then she said she was going to come back but never did. Instead a man named Sherwin came by and he said he was the manager and he was going to attend to us here on out. We were grateful for him helping us, we got a 7-8 dollar discount including removing the game charge and we were out of there.  Although Sherwin helped us out and he was nice and patient about it all,  This will be our first and last time that we will be there. Very bad waitresses. Next time I'll definitely try the sushi place.

Horrible service. Restaurant was nearly empty and no one at the host station. Finally John came, meandering.  Taking his time. No hurry that we stood waiting. After a slow walk to our table, the waitress came quick with menus and disappeared.  My son called anotger waitress to take our food & drink orders.  With a still nearly empty we waited & waited for a decent meal

The food was pretty good, but it was incredibly difficult to get the attention of any of the three people working the front. Our official waiter was supposed to be working the other side and, while he was enthusiastic and friendly, we almost never saw him. The two women who were working on our side of the restaurant didn't seem to notice we were looking for help, and never looked over to check. On a couple occasions, I had to walk over to them to ask them for service which, while I don't mind doing so, seemed like it should not have been needed since ethe restaurant was not especially busy (at leats on the side I was sitting on).  I didn't think the food took very long to arrive, but the woman from the kitchen seemed to think so. She let me know that my food was cooked the way I'd asked, but then proceeded to let me know that my order was why it 'took so long.' Which, while I understand was likely an accurate explanation, seemed to be an unneeded rude comment since it mainly just heavily implied that my order had been an inconvenience to her. I know she may not have been super excited to be there; some days in a restaurant are tough, but I always hate to see it taken out on a customer. Overall, my dining experience wasn't too bad; I would come back. I'm hoping it was an off day for many of the people working there since I've been there in the past and had better experiences. My most recent experience: 2/10 Past experiences: 6-7/10

I've been here a few times, because I love going to this mall. However, I feel like I've always had a problem with the customer service here. I don't like to be the person to complain, especially when it's just little things... But the first time I came here, our server didn't speak up at all and ended up getting my order wrong. I was so hungry that I just told them to not worry about it because my friends burger came already and I was just ready to eat. Thankfully, they gave me my food for free so that definitely made up for that. They also sent out a manager to apologize (which was cool, but maybe getting my order right from the start would have been cooler haha).  Anyways, so I went again last night, and I felt like my server was rushing me and it sort of made me grumpy, which is a shame because I really enjoyed my Whiskey River BBQ burger. Thus, my ambivalent rating of this location.

I really enjoyed my visit!  I ordered the Burnin' Love, because I'm single and I like to pretend food loves me back.  In all seriousness, the burger was really good! I ordered it well done, and they listened! Praise! Usually when I order, they still undercook it. This burger has fried jalapeño bits, which weren't spicy at all! It also came with pepper jack cheese, and a whole jalapeño on top!(best part, it was actually spicy)  I really like their fries, mainly because I liked dipping them in the sauces! I had the Thai spicy and sweet sauce. It gave the fries that extra kick!  It was pretty busy on a Wednesday evening. Still, Bianca was able to keep us happy and do her job efficiently. Thank you Bianca!
Griselle did an awesome job as a greeter and also very nice and polite. Always having a smile and great attitude. Julia did also lovely and she deserves a great high five.

Red Robin has always been great - but the server usually disappears once your food has arrived. I always suspected the bottomless fries to be the culprit. It seems like they would intentially hide so that you wouldn't ask them for fries after you've finished the first five they serve with your meal. Your server will be prompt and friendly in taking your order and will hide out while you eat. Once you've finished they are back again to ask if you'd like dessert, as if they were hiding and watching from afar.  However, service was definitely MUCH better tonight. I'm not sure if our waitress Bianca was new, or if there was a change in policy. She was very nice and helpful right from the start. Gave some good recommendations on the menu (by the way, the garlic fries are just fries with garlic ground onto them but they taste so much better). For the first time, we were checked in on every so often to make sure everything was OK. She offered to bring fries before we even thought of asking - I was astonished.  As for the food, great as usual... I think. I'm not sure if the D.G.B. burger is supposed to be served in a puddle of its own grease. The bottom bun was definitely soaked through and the arugula leaves were dripping - but it still tasted great. As I mentioned, the garlic fries are worth the upgrade especially if you ask for a side of garlic aioli.  I always drop by every now and then but if the service continues to be anything like what Bianca has shown us tonight, I will definitely be eating here more often!
I was completely disappointed that I could not get my fries before my meal came!! Bottomless fries I think not!!

Was here years ago and have read previous reviews about this place. But contrary to what others say, we actually had a very good experience. We came on a Sunday after mass and waited for a few minutes for the place to open at 11 am. The one who greeted us was prompt and friendly and sitted us immediately. Our server was friendly too, he talked to us and helped us with our order. They have this tablet in each table where you can order, play games while waiting for food and even pay if you can't find your server. (cool!) We had the Royal Red Robin - burgers with bacon and egg with American cheese; Bleu Ribbon burger - with chipotle aioli  and bleu cheese on an onion bun! (yum) - both with bottomless fries :), and for a dollar more you can have the flavored fries (I had the garlic parmesan...) Loved the Guiness beer float. Will be back for sure!

I've lived in L.A. for years and honestly never heard of Red Robin until I saw the promotion for the Terminator Genisys burger.  Went along to try it out and loved it. Good service.  The food was great!  Had a few really good cocktails too. I've read the other terrible reviews on Yelp for this Red Robin but my experience was great. The server, Michael, came by on a regular basis making sure we were okay.  Refilled our bottomless fries without us having to ask.  I'll definitely go back again!  The manage even came by at the end to find out if we had enjoyed our visit.  Two thumbs up.

This is my to-go spot for burgers whenever inside the Glendale Galleria. I go with the bacon cheeseburger and a side of fries or onion rings. That's my regular order. The burger is good. It's a decent size... About half a pound. The american cheese and the bacon with shredded lettuce and some tomatoes really top it off. They usually pack me a small plastic container of ranch dressing to go with the fries/onion rings. I keep forgetting to just let them know that all i need is a lot of ketchup... Service is pretty good. They cook to order so a little wait time is required.

The customer service here has definitely gone downhill. It could really use a revamp. The new kiosks with games now at each table that are supposed to improve your "service", are just a excuse to provide even less interaction with less staff.
