Obvious ploy to try and save on labor costs. Kiosks are convenience when paying if they would work properly. Have gone a couple times and it has only worked properly once. Two times it was out of paper, one time it would not read my rewards card and apply the appropriate discount. If you're going to introduce new technology, make sure it works. Maybe this place needs some new management to return it to the restaurant it once was. Food is still good and unlimited fries are appreciated, even though the initial side of fries they bring you are considerably smaller than before since they use a small metal ring to supposedly improve the astethic look of the burger when it arrives. The refill will be the plastic tray as they used to do with all sides of fries. Overall, if you're in a rush, not a place to go. decent food, just don't expect great service.

We came on a Sunday afternoon and ordered fried zucchini and cheese sticks for appetizer and bruschetta chicken burger with garlic fries for $15.  - Love the Red Royalty card. Got free a free appetizer! - Bruschetta chicken taste like a chicken salad in burger form. taste great! - Always love their bottomless garlic fries! gotta get it! just 50 cents more.  - Erika was very friendly. Not hectic. well managed service.  - Lots of TV's for sports.
Beer and burger are ok... I'm having fun at the pleasure in this space! The fries are bottomless! Ya we want the bartendar!

Love their bottomless fries, so much that I ordered a soup for my meal so that I have room to enjoy the fries from the bf's burger order. I got a bowl of the chicken tortilla soup and for what it was, it was rich and pretty filling. The peach iced tea (under 10 calories if you wanted to balance it out with all the bottomless fries) quenched my thirst and was super good. Our server (shoot, forgot her name) kept the fries coming, consistently checked on us, and even got us signed up for their loyalty program (this trip got us one visit closer to $20). Great option for food when you're shopping at the Galleria. The place also has plenty of seating!

Ok...ive been coming to this Red Robin for many many years. I even had my after wedding rehersal dinner here 9 years ago for me, my wife and 10 of our family members. I also have been to the Northridge Mall one.  They are all basically the same, i think their burgers have kinda gone downhill over the past few years. They seem to kinda be flavorless and smaller. I also hate the round tin thing they put the french fries in, just put a handful of fries on my plate like the good old days so i dont have to bug the waitress for more 5 minutes later. Ive had alot of service issues at this location along with the Northridge one in the past, im on this page cause i came here tonight for dinner. I like R.R. and will continue to go cause i hate mall food, and R.R. is something i settle on. But i do think they have gotten worse compared to 10 years ago.

I took the time to download the app so I could write this, I just want you to have an idea of how motivated I was by my experience here.  Last night me and my boyfriend were running errands around the Glendale Galleria and decided we'd splurge on a sit down dinner at Red Robin. Both of us have had good experiences with this establishment (not necessarily this location)  In order to bypass the wait we sat in the bar area, we didn't have a drink menu so we made our food selections first and when the waiter came by we ordered our food and a drink menu.  I got a "sand in my shorts" and Jerred got a Blood Orange Margarita, both were delicious, however I wish I had savored it more. We placed out orders roughly at 7:30... At 8:50 ONE AND A HALF HOURS LATER we FINALLY received our food, after watching several customers get up and leave without getting anything. I had ordered a chicken sandwich with a side salad, Jerred had ordered a burger (which they had to downgrade to a petite because they didn't have the normal sized patties) note to restaurants, if you don't have the requested item, upgrade them for free.  Needless to say we were starving when the food finally arrived. Jerred ordered the second round of his bottomless fries immediately, unsure of how long those would take.  After eating our meals entirely and waiting ANOTHER 15 minutes, our waiter somehow managed to make it to our table to say that the fries would be a little longer. We took the check.  The restaurant didn't seem super busy, and I get that sometimes this happens, but after all that j expected a comped drink, or a dessert sent out way (not that I would have wanted to wait for it) no dice. Just a "visit us again soon, guys" as our waiter shrunk bank to the kitchen in what I hope was shame. Needless to say I will NOT be coming back. Thank you.
Lots of people, we had to wait 45 minutes to be taken to a table. The food has a great presentation and is very tastie. The waitress never brought my lemon or dressing for my salad. :(

I've came here a few times now and it's never any good.  But today was the absolute worst.... service was horrible my fries and chicken were cold but my shrimp was hot... The servers watched 5 kids running around tables and people trying to eat why they climbed on top of tables and booths while people were trying to enjoy a meal.... I can't get out of this place fast enough... definitely will not be coming back here again I'd rather drive to covina in traffic then to come back here... ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE!!!! Can't belive how bad it was in here between kids running wild and bad service...

(Dined 12/16/11 F): Red Robin is simply one of my favorite chain restaurants (and that's saying a lot for me!) with wonderful burgers and unlimited fries! After an evening of Christmas shopping, I met up with a friend for dinner and some catching up. It's been awhile since I've had the pleasure of eating at Red Robin (and I love the Glendale location), which to me is a travesty in itself. This location seems to have so much more space than others I've been to. After having to wait for about 15 minutes to be seated (gave us a chance to begin catching up), we got a booth in the bar area, and I taking the seat facing the TV so I can catch whatever sports was showing. Our affable waiter, Derek, was immediately on us offering to take our drink order. After the customary water, I decided to take advantage of their evening happy hour (yes, you read that correctly, as I've always been harping about how unjust it is not to have extended happy hours...8pm-close Monday-Friday in this case), and ordered a frozen mango margarita ($3.50) while my friend a bottomless raspberry iced tea ($2.89). I've had both before, so needless to say, they both are thirst-quenching. You get real pulp in the mango margarita!   The rest of the meal consist of happy hour "zukes & shrooms" with ranch and sweet Thai sauce (fried zucchini and mushrooms - $5.00), the Sweet Jim Beam burger with unlimited fries ($9.79) for me, and the fish & chips ($11.99) for my friend. With the exception of the new Sweet Jim Beam burger, I've eaten everything else before, and as always, all very scrumptious. However, I would have liked a bigger portion of the zukes & shrooms. The fish & chips was a bountiful basket of steaming fish...bite-after-bite-after-bite. As for the burger, the size seemed a bit scaled down from their other burgers. However, the meat was perfectly prepared medium and all the rest of the toppings wasn't so overbearing. Although, I wouldn't complain if they wanted to use more Jim Beam. I would suggest even a little container with extra Jim Beam sauce on the side, like what TGI Friday's does with their Jack Daniels burger.   The service was great, even at this busy dinner time. Our waiter, Derek, had a great personality, was always checking on us if we needed more drinks, and filled out water glasses when they were getting low. If you get him, make sure to tip him well; he deserves it. Parking is ample since you are in the Glendale Galleria, located on the first floor close to Target. Overall, as I already prefaced, I love Red Robin. They offer a wide range of burgers (that's all I come here for), but they also offer salads, sandwiches, and full-meal entrees. Another fine dining experience with value-priced food (total bill before tip was about $36.00). Although they have unlimited fries, I have yet to ever request for more. And they take my credit card of choice...AMEX!
Love this place ! Burgers are great and bottomless fries are my favorite ! Highly recommend this place if u haven't tried it . Reasonable prices as well

First i would like to point out that i come to this franchise quite a bit. Never have i had a bad experience until tonight. First takes 5 mins of us standing waiting to be seated until i have to go out of my way to be noticed. Later to have the table behind us complaining to the manager that the food does not taste good. We wait almost 30 mins for our food to be ready.. for it to be undercooked and cold. Looks like my 5 year old daughter put something together out of play dough. I'm just grateful that this was not my first experience with this company or I would have never steoped foot in another red robbin again. Wish i could gice negative stars.

One of my favorite chain restaurants! The menu has so much variety and everything is pretty tasty! Plus, bottomless fries and strawberry lemonade - whats not to love?!!  The service at this location is relatively good and they have a separate bar area that is only 21+ so you can easily avoid the families with screaming children who are taking a break from shopping in the mall. This location is also huge so its a good place to come if you have a big group and everyone wants something a little different.
When I am not sure what I want to eat my default is Red Robin. Simple, quick and yummy. Freckled lemonade is my fav

Came here on a Sunday late morning before noon. The service was just super slow! The food it self was good and i couldnt complain. Its hard to come to place however when i cant even get a somewhat timely refill or have to wait 15-20 minutes just to get a check and pay for my meal.

Really like their new renovated menu. We Enjoyed the ruffled house made chips with this out of this world French onion dip. The Whiskey river burger is one of their classic staples & it's so good. I love how they have added several new dipping sauces to their menu. I got to try a few & the bacon one really stood out to me with their bottomless seasoned fries. I know it's a burger place but their fried fish & chips are so good here. I almost always get it to share with whoever I'm with. The Cod fish is fresh & battered correctly. The Freckled Lemonade is another favorite of mine as is the bottomless root beer floats. I am a sucker for root beer floats. Service has always been good every time I have come. Major plus that the location is inside the mall.

I've been going to Denny's and ihop a lot and wanted to try something new and red robin did not disappoint. Such great quality for a reasonable price and our server Andres and Michelle  would always check up on us and be really courteous even though we came in 20 min before closing. Definitely going to come back for happy hour and for some juicy burgers.

I received excellent service thanks to JONATHAN, the kitchen manager. He is very polite and offers great customer service. He is customer friendly and I will definitely return with my family. He has made our experience great!

Fun fun fun!! The Red Robin is in the newly renovated Galleria. Staff was great. I really liked the energy. The Banzai burger has pineapple and teriyaki. I like that they are flexible enough not to include cheese or mayo when the customer requests omissions. Sam Adams Octoberfest beer was good.. After all the great fries and onion rings we mall walked to work off the meal.

This red robins is located inside the shopping mall.  I really didn't enjoy my time here because it took forever for them to serve a table for 2. We barely ordered anything but it felt like we waited 30min.  If anything id prefer to go to The Habit, which isn't that far away.

This place has the best burgers around. It doesn't get much credit since it's located in the mall, but I really love coming here. They have a HUGE selection of burgers on their menu. Their thick cut wedge fries, topped off with their famous Red Robin seasoning is a must have. I love the vintage framed photos throughout the restaurant. Just a great place to stop off for a quick bite.

I like coming to this restaurant because their food is delicious. Especially their burgers and fries. Most of the time I order the Red's Tavern Double because it is my favorite burger. The environment is pretty good, including the staff. I'll definitely keep coming to Red Robin whenever I want to eat a good burger. Yumm!!

Went to this location for dinner on a Saturday night. Being the day after Christmas we excepted it to be pretty busy and were prepared for a wait. When we arrived the hostess told us it would be approximately 20 minutes. 20 minutes is a fairly short time for a Saturday for a party of three. 10 minutes later a server comes by and discusses with her about open tables, which lead to us being seated. We then over bearded the server discussing the arrangement of the tables and were switched servers but were never notified.  Honestly I don't care about being notified I just would like to know who I need to flag down because the entire night it felt like we had to keep playing where's Waldo because she never brought anything to our table. Starting with ordering food and then asking for utensils and napkins once they brought our appetizer which should be a given. I mean we only ordered the onion rings but at least bring us some freakin' napkins. She passed by several times and could clearly see what was on our table because we were in front of the kitchen, but she just seemed so ignorant and blind as to what we needed. Other workers were more helpful with refills. It was not only the server but the kitchen as well because I order medium for my burger and my girlfriend order medium-well, and both our burgers were burnt on the edges are were extremely dry. We felt sick after eating those burgers but we were waiting 30 mins for our food that we were just staring, after am approximately 50 minute wait period from the moment we walked in. I guess the overall timing on when we arrived was bad because it was just about 90 minutes before closing but I feel like there should be no excuse for the way the food should be cooked. As far as the waitress, I would rather wait an additional 20 minutes for a table, then to be seated early and receive A has ass service, with a waitress who seems to try to avoid our tables which is right in front of the kitchen (That table being the easiest to accommodate for since everything is so close). I do not hold this against the store or the establishment of Red Robins because there burgers have always been good, but I'm just very disappointed that someone could receive such a unsatisfying burger and service from a Red Robins...

First time at this restaurant and I had a good experience. We had good customer service and our food came at a descent time.  Now to the burgers they are pretty good and all the ingredients taste and look fresh. The only thing I did not like were the French fries. I prefer thin cut and this are thick but that's just my personal taste.  I'll come back if I am in the mood for burgers and want to have this in a more formal setting.

This place used to be decent but after going here for the past 5 years I have to say it has hit a major low. The food is bad, the restaurant is dirty. The bathrooms are filthy and the service is terrible. I came here with my toddler and the server didn't even give us any utensils to eat our food. He had to ask for them. What a freaking joke. After visit this place for the last five years I am done with this place. Red robin you were good at one time but now it's time to pull the trigger good bye old friend good bye.

The service here is beyond slow. I could probably shop at a store and back before they come to take my order. Then shop another 2-3 stores before my food comes. Then another 1-2 stores before they realize I need a refill on my Freckled Lemonade. The shopping store number goes on and on.  Food itself is great. I like Red Robin especially for their bottomless drinks and fries. But the service at this particular location is about the worst I've experienced at a Red Robin. Just be prepare to wait especially during the weekend. Don't come when you're starving because well, you'll be starving some more.  The Prime Chophouse is my choice of burger. It got mushroom and cheese, my two favorite toppings for burgers. I always ask for it split so it's easier for me to eat, because a small girl like me can't fit that huge of a burger in my mouth easily!

Prices are decent and burgers are good. Since it is inside the mall, I tend to forget this place is even here. Plus it's a good option compared to the food court where everybody is hunting down a table. Bottomless fries is a plus and bottomless root beer floats are a fun treat. The blue ribbon burger was really tasty AND IM A SUPER FAN OF THEIR SIGNATURE BLEND SEASONING!!!
This place is great the service is good. Burgers are good they give unlimited French fries. Also the burgers are juicy and well cooked. Overall this place is a really good place to go to

Rude rude rude  I was at red robin on 01/01/15 about 12:15 The host was so rude tall wearing all black I guess he didn't want it to work on the first of the month I was there with my kids and wife we ask for a table and for some reason he just having a bad time I been coming to this location for about 2 years but now I don't I be coming no more there's so many nice servers there but this guy was so rude sarcastic I hope the manager read this do something about this

Today's highlight was watching the host attempt to kill a cockroach that was pointed out by two customers. The cockroach flew briefly into the air whist in capture causing the host to scream. We quietly slid out of our booth and left. We had been waiting 20 minutes to order anyway ... life spared.
By far this place has gone down a long long spiral. Food is bad and the customer service my lord. If you want red Robin don't come here. Save yourself.
Good service, adult menu is good, including drinks... I have yet to order a kids item that my kids actually like.

Yep service was as terrible as they say it is. I had world's most annoyed bartender. I assume the clientele must tip like shit cause bad service is usually a result of too many cheapskates. Speaking of cheap I got a free birthday burger coupon in my inbox and being that I've never tried red robin and love a good veggie burger I decided this was my initiation. Wow, my burger sucked. I looked online to see what boca burgers were supposed to look like...no where near what I got. That and the bartender was so short with me. I thought I was dining in but nope he made mine to go without telling me. I left him a tip anyhow cause I felt sorry for his crap attitude.

I used to be a huge fan of this place but recently it's gotten terrible. It's so hot in here, there's nothing but empty tables and no one wanted to wait us ( we literally heard them complaining about going to us ) we waited for like 10 minutes to just seat us. This red Robbin is the worst I've ever been to and I don't recommend coming here. You're better off going to the food court! Don't waste your money or time here

In general, Red Robin's is a great burger place with some fantastic shakes and strawberry freckled lemonade.  My review is to let you in on a discovery I found out on this particular eat out at Red Robin's...You know those bottomless fries served with the burgers? They have a GARLIC FRIES option! Soooo good!
Horrible service. Our waiter had the "I don't really care" attitude the whole time. Food is mediocre. Nothing really special. The only thing I enjoy here are the endless fries.

Came here the other day with my Bro & friend. It wasn't my 1st choice but majority rules so we ate here. This restaurant location has kind of a strange lay out structurally which I imagine can't make it very easy for the servers when it gets busy. Luckily it wasn't busy so service was no issue. My friend ordered the BBQ wrap ($10), My brother got the Chicken Bruschetta sandwich on Ciabatta ($12.50) & I got the Simply Chicken sandwich ($9). They both opted for bottomless steak fries & I tried to be healthier and got the "fruit" salad. My friend loves the wrap & ordered it without ranch and honey mustard on the side... I clearly heard him say this but his wrap came with the ranch on it, which if you are trying to be healthier you know that ranch instantly makes the sandwich 2X as bad for you. Anyway my friend is too nice and didn't want to complain/have it sent back... that doesn't mean I can't put it on yelp though right?! Our server was nice and everything else service wise was fine besides this.  My brother loved his chicken bruschetta sandwich, and the steak fries were good and the waitress kept them coming. My sandwich was simple and good, just what I wanted, however the fruit salad was very forgettable and anything but fresh. If I had known it was basically out of the can I would have just gotten the fries heads up to those of you debating getting the fruit salad here. This is a good spot to stop for a chicken sandwich or a burger if you are ok with spending $15 per person. We enjoyed most of our food some minor issues but overall fine casual dining experience. I wouldn't go out of my way to come here but if I am at the Galleria again and a group wants to stop here I wouldn't be opposed either.

The service is great here. I came on a Monday night with my husband and mother in law, plus two kids. It was pretty late, but they were very efficient. We were seated right away, and our drinks were served immediately. Our server ( his name starts with an a, I wish I could remember) was exceptionally friendly and accommodating. There was a large birthday party ahead of us, and they let us know right away that there might be a short delay. Because they told us, we were happy to wait. We didn't have to wait long at all for our food, which was delicious. I had the chicken tortilla soup, and it was fantastic. Then the manager came out and comped my mother in laws chicken sandwich because there had been a miscommunication about it. Absolute class act. I will come here again!

2 stars for the fries only! I've been to red robin plenty of times, but this trip was disappointing. Burgers were blah and even though they are endless fries, they barley serve you anything. For $10-$12 for a burger, I would have been happier at In n Out.

The service here is absolutely horrible.  Took them an hr to get the food ready.  The order was wrong.  The bill was wrong.  You literally had to look for the server to get any service.   The food is ok.  Will not be back to this branch!
the burger and fries was great.  it filled me up for the day.  taste was on point, nothing too salty or bland.

Bad service. Food was horrible!!! Cold and soggy fries. Waiting 40 mins for food and 20 for drinks. No runners around to deliver. Won't be back again.  $185 for cold food and bad service!!! Really mad!  Calling cooperate tomorrow rediculous!!    Even worse now. They charged me twice for this god awful food thank god my bank alerts me !  Cooperate is going to hear of this

Love this place! always come by when cruzin the mall!  We sat in the bar!they were busy on this sat afternoon!food was amazing! I had the blu burger and tried the new dipping sauces! I loved everything!especially the bottomless fries! Our server, Mike was awesome!even though it was busy he was attentive and on top if everything!he really impressed us!  Thanks we will be back for drinks next time!
Eat here every so often. Kids love it. They're happy, I'm happy. Only way I can convince them to go the mall!
For a chain it's great. I didn't even know they had these outside of the Midwest but I'm happy to find it in Glendale. Way better than TGIF or Chillis!

Worst customer service ever! Second time coming to this location . Waited to long for food and refill on drinks. Just horrible! Ill just stick to the location in santa anita they have the best customer service ever.

So I've always been a huge Red Robin fan. Unfortunately I've been to this location 4+ times and never had a good experience. The service is always really poor and the food takes forever and isn't very good.  This past visit was the worst yet. We waited a really long time for our food. My friend had ordered a burger well done, but it had pink in it. The bacon cheeseburger came without bacon and my gluten free burger came on a regular bun. We didn't receive discounts for any of this, and the waiter brought me a dry gluten free bun with nothing on it so I could move the burger over. He also switched our credit cards when we paid our checks.  Unfortunately although Red Robin is one of my favorite chains, I won't be coming back to this one anytime soon.

This is Red Robin. Nothing spectacular can really be expected here. Food is good, service is always hit or miss. My past experience here wasn't fabulous but wasn't horrible either.  Came here on a Saturday afternoon for lunch, we were greeted, given a table and a high chair for my friends daughter. I know that the waitress we had was really busy, I was watching her and could tell that the amount of tables she had was a tad overwhelming, so for that, I can cut her some slack. She was nice and you could tell she was really trying to make everyone happy. Can't complain about that.  I ordered the blackened chicken sandwich, fries and I got a side salad with ranch. My friend ordered the buffalo chicken fingers and salad, and a corn dog and fries for her daughter off the kids menu. The chicken sandwich I got was mediocre, I wouldn't get it again. I enjoyed the buffalo chicken tenders more than my meal. I was disappointed that our salads weren't at our table before our meal though, like we had asked. Again, waitress was overly busy so I wasn't going to complain.  She brought the check and forgot to order a to go order we were taking home to a friend of ours. I had to remind her of that, she was very apologetic, and of course I understood and reminded her that I know shes very busy which I think relieved her. I waited around while my friend took her daughter next door to Target while I paid for us. I asked for change and instead she charged all of it to my bill and brought that change. Ugh. Maybe I wasn't thorough though, so I had to tell her that the change I wanted was so I could pay for my share. She was very quick to give me all of the change and I put my cash in and gave my friends card to pay for her share. In counting the change back, I realized that she had short changed me $20.  Waitress came back with the to go order and the bill. Before I could even tell her about the $20, she opened the bill up and told me that I had accidentally put the $20 in there. I really appreciated that as I must have done that by accident, as I know that most people wouldn't risk their jobs for an extra $20, and I let her know that it wasn't a problem, I just appreciated that she was very quick to point it out and it made me feel bad that I think she thought I would complain about her regarding the ordeal. If anything I wanted to let a manager know how hard I saw her working to please all the tables she was waiting on and had a good attitude while doing it. I would definitely come back here during a less hectic time to try another dish. The waitress we had was pleasant, and from what I could tell, so were all the other ones on the floor.

I came here for the first time Monday night with my girlfriend. I had a burger and sweet potato fries; didn't expect the food to be as good as it was. Zach was our waiter, he was really nice and his timing was on point and everything. Customer service means a lot to me, so thanks Zach!  Definitely going to stop by again.

My girl and I have been here 5 times now, and every time, we've been very happy.  Great atmosphere, can walk into the mall from the restaurant, Monica is a great server every time, and Effrem is a great, personable manager.  Everyone there goes the extra mile, burgers are great, and believe it or not, the regular fries are better than the sweet potato fries.  I'm coming here again and again.  Our first server was April, and now she's a manager, which she excels in as well.

Wonderful experience with a minor mishap. We were seated promptly and the waitress was amazingly friendly and accommodating from the beginning. She checked up on us while we waited for the food and brought a refill even though my glass was dull half full. She made sure everything was to our tasting  and when asked for crispier fries brought them out without a fuss.  The mishap was the burger itself. I ordered the Sautéed 'Shroom ... But it was a bit bland. The side of garlic aioli helped with the taste. Also the bottom bun was soaked through. Not a fan of a soggy bread/bun!!  But overall experience was great! The service A+, the atmosphere A+, the cleanliness A+!  We will be back!

Home to the worst bathrooms in Glendale. Puddles of wet spots, towels over flowing in huge garbage cans, and urine smell so strong it burns. Service is always good, food is always good and drinks are always good. But that bathroom, yuck!

We had the Burning Love Burger it had bacon, cheese, and deep fried jalapenos, 5 stars! The hamburger was juicy and had a lot of flavor and the bun was nice and soft; it made me happy! The Root Beer Float is bottomless and has soft serve! The Freckled Strawberry Lemonade was good, too! We had the happy hour Buffalo wings, love it. The Clam Chowder was awesome. I love the feeling of sitting down at a restaurant (not food court) after some extreme shopping :)

Host was ignoring us when we first came in, we had to get his attention and then he whispered inaudibly where we should sit. Our waiter was fine. Ordered a burger and was not asked how I wanted it cooked which is usually asked at the other red Robins I've been too? My burger was overcooked and dry, cool, the bun was on the verge of stale. I love Red Robin but this was one wasn't up to the Red Robin standard I feel. I was really surprised and dissapointed. Would not return.

Go back to serving your food in baskets. Those metal sleeves for the fires suck and don't allow you to give as many fries as the baskets. And switch back to tobasco, chalula sauce is weak and not even hot. Earn the greatness back that red robin once had!

I don't get it.  Red Robin had been around for years yet I've never been to one.  Now that I have, I won't be back.  I ordered the mushroom burger.  It was literally a burger, a slice of cheese and some mushrooms.  It was actually pretty dry and tasteless.  I actually enjoy a Big Mac much, Much, MUCH more.   I'll agree with other reviewers about slow service.   But I'll disagree about the servers attitudes.  Everyone was very, very nice.
I used to come here more often, but now that I live in the LA area its harder for me to stop by.  ENDLESS Fries ! Freckled Lemonade ! Buzzard Hot Wings ! Burnin' Love Burger! Gingerbread Milkshake !

Service is good. But honestly why is it this place can never have a reasonably clean men's bathroom. Step in the bathroom and it changes your view of this restaurant real quick.
