We had such a great experience!  Bill was our server and he was so entertaining and so nice. If you are in the area I definitely suggest coming here and asking for bill. Oh and the food was amazing as well!

the food is good. had never ate from here til about a month ago now. the people are nice and friendly.  but I've had a few incidents in the past couple of orders.  they have made me wait over 20 minutes after ordering on the phone and told to pick up within 20 minutes.... show up about 40 minutes later and had to wait.... and they still got the order wrong.... I order from here as they have gluten free options and it's hard to find a place....

Honestly horrible service. I tried to order a drink but left my drivers license in my vehicle on the other side of the mall. I only had my military ID. First waitress was hesitant and said she would get someone else to verify, idk how many other people had to see my ID for them to say no they wouldn't serve me. I was okay with it it was my fault for leaving my drivers license in my car but they could of done it with out all the attitude.

I ordered our food for pickup. It was my friend's birthday and he was due a free birthday Burger. When I called, I spoke with the manager, Sonny. He was awesome. The Birthday burger is only supposed to be offered for eat-in but he said that he would make an exception as long as we had the barcode from the promotional email to scan.  I wasn't sure if my friend had his coupon but I accepted and ordered anyway. When we arrived at Red Robin, I spoke with Zachary at the bar/to go pick-up, where our order was already ready.  Zachary was the worst! My friend handed over his red robin card. For some reason it didn't go through and Zachary didn't offer us a discount (which, okay fine), but he didn't even seem apologetic.  Then, after pouring my lemonade into a to-go cup, he set it down RIGHT in the middle of a bunch of spilled juice that was there before we came. I brought it to his attention and told him that I needed a new cup.  He didn't apologize or even acknowledge that what he'd done was an error. WTH man! Learn some manners and CLEAN YOUR STATION! Had he done that beforehand, this wouldn't have been an issue. Not to mention that he had placed our to-go back in said mess before we arrived, my friend moved it as soon as we got there.  Messy ass bartender.  And rude to boot. If you want a good drink AND good service, you may want to call ahead and see if Zachary is working.  If so, take a pass. Also - food = mediocre at best.  Fries are bland and burgers are so-so.

I ordered the spicy love burger or whatever the jalapeño burger is called with both the salsa and spicy sauce on the side with onion straws. I receive my order and open the box to find the onion straws were burnt and my burger had both sauces on it. I go back in and tell them I hate to complain, but my order is incorrect and ask them to make it. I understand mistakes happen. No biggie. The guy who I dealt with was very unapologetic and almost annoyed with me then started whispering to another co worker right in front of me while both glaring at me. Very unprofessional, but whatever I just want my food. Then I receive my new burger with a few apologies from the manager and go home. I get home to find half of my onion straws still burnt like they threw the new batch in with the old and A FREAKING HAIR. A HAIR ON MY BURGER. I have never been so disgusted with a kitchen in my entire life. I give you a second chance to make my order and I find a hair. I will never be back to this place. So disgusting.

I have come here a good amount of times to know that their service is the best. I love their juicy burgers, especially veggie options for burgers.  The friendly host seated us right away. Tonight when I ordered, I forgot which veggie burger I loved more, the veggie or vegan. I chose the veggie one at first and was totally wrong. I felt really bad that I did not like it, I rarely ever order the wrong item, and told our server April. She was absolutely sweet and sympathetic, right away she said it was not a problem and asked me what I would like to try instead. I told her the boca vegan burger and right away she got my order. The whole night she took care of us with a smile. April thank you for being so nice, my favorite server now! As for my burger, the boca vegan burger was juicy and delicious. The difference, so I will remember, is that the veggie has a dry quinoa rice texture with cheese and the vegan patty is bigger and has no cheese, but a creamy sauce. Overall again a great experience at this location because of the service.

Lettuced wrapped burger A1 peppercorn burger with a side salad...nothing wrong with that at all. I love red robin and how it isn't a hassle to ask to skip the bun. I love their fries more but I can't have them so the side salad will just have to do. At least their ranch dressing is amazing. Thanks for letting us low carbers low carb in peace.

When we went there a couple weeks ago and while we were there there were 2 very LARGE cockroaches crawling along the walls. I let the waiter know and than the manger came and talked to me. Said " well they don't come near the food" what?! So they knew?! So disgusting! Never again!!!

I heard they are closing.   That mall is dying with Nordstrom gone.  Plus once it really became the "Ghetto-ria" we stopped going to this Red Robin around 2001 or so.  Hopefully they will open up somewhere else in the South Bay... Hopefully Del Amo!!!

I went there two times before posting a review, but i saw no change. Very rude. Slowest service ever. The fries were delivered cold to me and the exchange took very long. The bad service ruined the entire experience.

Really really bad costumer service,  the food was good but I have never been to a red robin with this bad of costumer service. I would bot recommend this place if you can find another red robin you should go there instead.

I really like this place. They have a wide range of burgers to eat, they are able to modify them and the bottomless fries. How can you go wrong with the bottomless fries? I really enjoy the burnin love burger. It has just the right amount of spice

What a disappointment. Took 15Mins for our server Kristian to come and greet us, and another 10 mins just for our drinks to arrive (because we had to ask for them). We canceled our order and left. Unless you have 2 hours to kill, this place is not worth the wait.

We love Red Robin but this visit really disappointed us. The waitress was overwhelmed with her tables. We had to ask the host for silverware and napkins. We ordered bottomless root beer and lemonade but the waitress rarely came to our table so we didn't even get a second refill. The guacamole was brown. The waitress did give us a new guacamole but no new chips. The waitress blamed the kitchen and said that they were super busy but we got to the restaurant at the end of the dinner rush and tables were leaving. Our fries were cold and the soup didn't come with the bread because the kitchen was behind. The waitress rarely came to our table. When I asked her for the check I told her we needed to leave and she still took 2 minutes. As soon as she gave it to me I gave it right back with my credit card and told her to please take it. When she brought our check back she brings us the soup bread in a to go box and apologized for the third time. The apology was very fake with no emotion and I did not want the bread to take home. The bread is thin and cut in to triangles, it is not a special bread that you crave after you leave the restaurant. I wanted the bread with my soup.

I was seriously appalled. The waiter was extremely inattentive and rushed (and it wasn't even that crowded.) It took ten minutes to get me a glass of water. He never came back to refill it. The food was not great. Overpriced considering its quality, in my opinion. I only stopped in here because it was closer than the food court and we were hungry, but seriously, I would've been better off at the target food court. I will never eat here again.

Our visit tonight was fantastic thanks to Brandon! As you can read my last visit was awful :( Thanks for the friendly service even when I spilled my bfs milkshake all over the table lol I also got my burger for free because I belong to the loyalty program! Wait I still have half my burger in fridge?! BYE!! (Runs to the fridge!)

How sad is it when you are starving after hours of walking through the Glendale Galleria and you walk to Red Robins for a good lunch and the staff doesn't greet you?  It was about 1:30 in the afternoon and there were plenty of empty tables.   There was one person cleaning the table.... No greeting, or I will right with you. Another person talking to another customer who is in the process of leaving sees me and once again the same treatment as the other employee. Waited another minute or two no one came to greet and seat me and decided that based on how I was viewed and treated as a customer that they obviously did not need my patronage. Yes... I walked out.
Service was great and the food was just ok. I was expecting more because of the price but overall pretty decent.

Red Robin........  (yummm????)  more like get your act together.  Simple drink order and can't remember one out of the 3 drinks ordered, coke.  Then refills my roommates drink with coke when he is diabetic (type 1).  Then my other roommate orders a glass of coke he gets one with a bug in it.  Then the next fresh glass of coke had a lemon seed in it but no lemon. (lemon was not requested)  Pure disappointment tonight.  With all the issues we had not one did a manager come by to check on us.

Horrible Service not even worth a star!! This was our first and last experience at Red Robin. The restaurant was not even half full nor did they have anyone waiting to be seated when we walked in. The hostess never acknowledged us, we waited patiently as she took a To Go order and even when she walked away to put that order in. After a few minutes another host came over and sat us in the bar area and told us our server would be right with us. Again, we waited patiently for 10 minutes with no waiter or any patience left and walked out. We will never return to Red Robin!

This place is normally great. By this place I mean red Robins .  This was My first time at this one in Glendale and I had the worst service ever.i ordered an appetizer and never received it. She didn't remember but it was on the bill. I tipped 0 I absolutely hate not tipping but I also feel you have to earn it as well. I would not recommend this place to any one.

Sure the bottomless fries are great. But maybe it was our server - giving our kids chocolate milk after we specifically asked for plain milk really was not enjoyable. Also, I would have thought that ordering an appetizer would have meant that it would have come out a few minutes ahead of our meals. Very disappointing.

This place has gone down hill!!! My burger was dry so was my Girl Friends, I paid a dollar more for garlic fries I got a sprinkle of garlic, the fries were super dry like about to cold. The service wasn't good they took forever to bring out nasty food. Me and my girl friend agreed we would not come back here.

Absolute terrible service and terrible food. Our waitress hardly paid any attention to us. It wasn't even busy. 15 minutes to get two drinks? And I'm not even exaggerating. We told her we were ready to order and she seemed to have forgotten about us because we had to flag her down again ten minutes later. We came to celebrate a birthday but she made the experience awful thanks for that. We had a couple people join us after and it took them 20 minutes to get their drinks again no exaggeration. The waitress finally seemed to care when I started talking to the manager. I'm a server and a manager at a restaurant so I'm very understandable and patient but this was just terrible. Our orders came out all wrong too and it was cold and fries were stale. The only person who seemed to help us and cared was the male host. We planned on getting dessert for my husbands birthday but after food taking 30 minutes and hardly any attention from our server we skipped it. She couldn't even get us the napkins we asked for. They need to not hire inexperienced servers because they are going to lose customers that way. I was 9 months pregnant and tackling the whole restaurant serving by myself with no complaints from any table. If she can't handle a few tables with basic needs then you guys need better servers. Never coming back again. ----my mom paid for dinner she just checked her bank statements and she got charged twice!!! Really?! My mom called to report the issue and the manager didn't know how to fix it. Seriously?!

What the heck happened to this place?!  I used to come in, have great, i mean GREAT service and good large food.   My burger today looks just like McDonald's  $1.50 double cheeseburger!  I have waited 15 mins since food delivery for extra requested condiments.   Eventually had to go to kitchen and ask for them myself.  My son even said "its slow and empty right now, i can only imagine how bad it would be if it was busy!" Joooooooke!!!!!  Waiting for extra fries ....still waiting.

Great bloody Mary's!! Had the Bourbon burger and fries.  Fries got cold quick. Service was good. Medium rare meat patty was on point.... scratch that! I got some of the worst food poisoning from that burger! I was sick at a friends house for 4 days puking my guts out! I wouldnt eat a burger there again unless it was sent out as black as a hockey puck!!!

I always DISLIKE restaurants that make you wait even though they have tons of tables and wait staff available. Red Robin, Glendale Galleria, you're guilty! There's no reason I have to wait 10 mins for a table when you have plenty of seats. There's no reason why you put me on the other section without the NFL on either.  =) Red Robin has good food, burgers, endless fat fries and cool sodas and drink creations! They always have good service too. Everything is pretty good about this place and location minus the extra wait for the table.

Placed an order to pick up. When I got there that had closed the entrance from the galleria side. And I was standing there for 10mins, workers clearly saw me. No one came and assisted me to let me know how I can pick up my order. Very disappointed.
Fries are still good And beer in mall can't go wrong. Great service

I love red robbins....its one of those places were its really hard to get something bad!... i wouldnt come here if i was craving a meal, their entrees are alright but u have to come here if u want a burger!... if u dnt like ur burger u get Bottomeles steak fries anyway, so u fill urself up with that!... win win situation. Christmas time they have the GINGERBREAD MILKSHAKE! OHH MY GOODNESS, OH MY GOODNESS!!...best shake in the world!!
Bottomless french fries and drinks. I ordered ceasar chicken wrap with clam chowder soup and its good.
Never in my life have I been to a Red Robins who did not accept my military ID. We spoke to the manager and she told us that this is a company policy. I call BS. Never will I eat at this place.
Stay away from the receptionist. Servers are great though! **BAD EXPERIENCE!!! For the receptionist, if you don't want your job. GET A NEW ONE!!!**

I have always been a fan of Red Robbin, I've been eating here since I was a little girl. The bottomless fries and seasoning are to die for. The service is consistent, and i always have a great experience visiting this location.

Luckily, I've always had impeccable service here, let's cross our fingers and hope this continues! Sometimes, I think the servers are reading my mind: "Hm, I guess it's about time for a refill... whoop, here it is!" Would recommend the Bleu Ribbon and Whiskey River burger, asking for a serving of fries before your entrees come out (hellooo free appetizer!), and the freckled lemonade. A little on the pricey side for a burger, but life can't be perfect.

My girlfriend and I walked in there last night, sorta wondered around trying to figure out if there was anyone that worked there that would be so kind to seat us. After walking around the entire place the manager came over and sat us and apologized. We then waited and waited and waited a little more. After flagging down our waiter and having him take our drink order  we then waited and waited and waited some more. I ordered a beer, waited over 10 minutes for it as I watched the "hostess" stand there doing absolutely nothing as the inexperienced waiter floundered over the stress of 5 tables. The wait for the food was about 20 minutes .Our appetizer came out around the same time our food did, terrible. The entire point of an appetizer is to eat it before your main course arrives, not at the same time so one gets cold. Will not be returning to this location.

FOOD Kids menu - Grilled chicken on stick, steamed broccoli, chocolate milk $5.  This is a great deal for kids.  Annoyed that they got the wrong and took them till the end of the meal to bring the chicken, they seemed genuinely sorry for it, so I can understand.   Guacamole Bacon Burger:  Great and juicy.  I'd say better than Islands a tad bit. Sauteed Mushroom Burger:  Hubby liked it. ATMOSPHERE Located inside the Glendale Galleria so it's a diner type place to take a break from a long day of shopping.  Great for kids too as it's noisy.

Came here with the boyfriend, he doesn't have this place in Miami unless you drive out for 30min or so to grab a bite. So the bf enjoyed the place and the food. To me it seemed like any other restaurant, I did however like on how they offer sweet potato fries. To come think of it every where offers that now. Our server was nice.
Horrible service !!! I placed an order to go and they took forever ! I was on my lunch break and it was over before I got my order ! And I had placed the order before I arrived . Never again!!!
My wife and I had great burgers the fries are delicious and service was excellent. We love to come here at least lest once a week .

I used to eat here a lot with friends when I was in my early 20s. It's basically the only sit-down restaurant in the Glendale Galleria, so it's nice to be able to take a load off after some shopping. Yesterday I went back for the first time in over a decade, and it was a disappointing experience. The food is not bad. In fact, the bottom-less steak fries are really good. They serve your basic hearty and unhealthy burgers, sandwiches, and a variety of fried stuff (onion rings, zucchini, clam strips, fish, etc.). It's not easy to mess up this basic fare, and they don't. But the service ruined an otherwise good meal. I know this is not the Ivy, and I'm not expecting 5-star service here. But I would like to have my drink refilled once in awhile or even a quick "how you guys doing?" But our waitress all but disappeared during our meal. We had to wait forever to get our drinks, have our order taken, and have our check delivered. The ONLY time the waitress acted nice was when she brought the check, no doubt hoping for more than a 4-cent tip. There seemed to be a morale problem with the wait staff in general. This one guy kept yelling at his co-workers from across the room which startled us a few times. Given the decent fried food, I hope this place will do something about the people who work here.
Best Red Robin I have been to yet! Food was hot and delicious and came out fast. Employees were attentive and friendly. I will be back!

My first visit to a Red Robin was at this location, and it was a very good one. The server was friendly, helpful, and VERY attentive. He checked up on us a lot, but that's okay because he was great! I'm sad to say I forgot his name, but he was a great server. I had the California chicken because the guacamole caught my attention. The burger itself was good, and it was big enough that I had to take half home. The bottomless fries sprinkled with the signature blend of seasonings were also really yummy! I'm glad to say my first time here turned out to be a positive experience.

So I went inside this restaurant with my family the host her name was crystal didn't even acknowledge that there was a group of people infront of her and when she finally looked up she didn't even greet us and she just had an attitude worst customer service

Came here for veterans day. Service was super slow! I had to ask the hostess twice to please let our server know we were ready to order.  No one brought water, no one even started us off with drinks.  Server finally came after 12 minutes of sitting there, we ordered- food came then server was off the grid again.  I finally asked to speak to a manager, the server had an issue with another table which resulted on the delay on service...  Our table should not have to suffer on another table's issue.  Poor training and management! Will need to feed my burger craving elsewhere.  2 stars because i love the freckled lemonade

Always a fan of red robin!  Speckled lemonade, bottomless fries with amazing seasoning!  I got the mushroom burger this time, and it was just as delicious as I remembered it.  The service here was very polite and fast!

The place is really nice and organized. The waiters and waitresses are very polite too. I kind of don't like where it's located because I have to come to the mall but that's alright. Also the food is very good , I recommend the BBQ chicken wrap, it's delicious !!!
Customer Service was great! The buffalo wings and the onion rings were far beyond amazing!! Plenty of flat screens in the restaurant and the Gold Margarita is a must try! I will come back.

Not worth it. I took my family to Red Robin yesterday, and the two stars are for the friendly service. I ordered a Gardenburger with green chili and pepper jack. For almost ten bucks, the burger was on the small side. It tasted OK. The bottomless fries -- well, they start you with a small amount. They tasted fine. No one ever offered to bring more, although I'm sure they would have if we'd asked. My wife got a Gardenburger and asked for the "freckled fruit" on the side. We asked our server why it was called freckled fruit, and she said she had no idea, maybe the strawberry seeds? It didn't matter, because they messed up and brought her fries instead of the fruit. My son got a kid's grilled cheese with that infamous "freckled fruit," which turned out to be a tiny little ramekin of mushy-looking fruit. Was it compote or fresh fruit? Couldn't tell, and my son didn't want to touch it. Our Cokes were $2.79 each -- only order those if you plan to drink a lot of it! (And yes, they did bring us refills promptly throughout the meal.) Overall, the food at Red Robin is edible, but the prices are verging on too high for what you get. For my money, I'd say Islands has better food when you're out looking for a burger. Islands is right across the street from the Glendale Galleria, so that's where I'll head next time.

I usually like to have dinner at this Red Robin while shopping at the Glendale Galleria.  This time,  the experience was less than superb.   After being seated,  the waiter took a long time to get around to us.  He seemed busy juggling multiple tables so I understood and waited patiently.  Order was placed and small requests like a knife and lemon in a drink were never fulfilled. A different person arrived with the food and while my burger was good,  no one ever returned for to check for drink refills or for more fries...  (bottomless.. right!) After finishing,  the waiter reappeared and asked if there was anything else.  I asked for the bill and he took a long time to process the payment.   I understand if the staff is busy with many tables to service but to disappear altogether is not right.

Restaurant is half empty yet there is a half hour wait.  Three hosts stand around looking bored chatting with one another.  Save for actual bar the bar area is completely empty, yet they are not allowing adults to sit here and order drinks while waiting for tables.  Did i mention its Saturday night?  Same thing on my last attempted visit, Its like they don't want to sell food , cocktails, or make money!   Its clear this is a dying restaurant.
Me and my boyfriend had a long day of shopping and wanted to eat something different. We couldn't find anything so we came here. At the same time we love red robins lol great food great time!!!
This is my spot when it comes to hamburgers!!  I always get the banzai burger with a freckled lemonade. so yummy!!! Everytime my boyfriend and I come here , we always, Always get awesome service!

Only reviewing the bar, although the burgers here are amazing.  This isn't my local red Robbin so when ever I'm at this location it's to have a couple of drinks before I'm shopping or to drown my sorrows in all the money I spent.  All the bartenders here are nice and attentive. They will keep checking up on you and make sure you are having a good time. A good place to have a good time with some friends.

Service is terrible. TERRIBLE. The worst, but the food is good and the location is convenient. Prices are average and food is better than average but the service is TERRIBLE, don't god unless you a lot of time to waste.

Red Robin is an okay restaurant. Food: This is a burger joint but they also sell other things bedsides burgers, like sandwiches, salads, etc. The burgers are your typical restaurant burgers. They aren't amazing but they're also not terrible.  The patties are semi tasty and the fries are pretty good. I think they give you refills with your fries, so that's a plus. Customer service:  Was alright. I have no complaints with the wait staff here, if anything during my last visit the waiter was a bit too attentive, but that is fine with me, at least he's doing his job. Overall this place is alright, I probably won't come here that often because I'd rather go elsewhere for better food. Pricing: Reasonable. A meal per person is around $10-$13 dollars.
Melissa (one of the managers) was super nice. Great customer service skills. Our waitor wasn't very helpful otherwise this would be a 5 star review but thank you Melissa for making our day.

I'd never been to Red Robin before last night, after seeing two people mention it on facebook in the span of an hour I decided to give it a shot. Friday night  around 8PM got there and was told there was a ten minute wait - not bad at all for a Friday night. It was busy, but not overly so and they were turning tables quickly so the wait times were very reasonable. Our server was Ryo, who was an AWESOME server. Kudos to him!  I even flagged down his manager to complement him. Ryo was very knowledgeable of the menu, and very kind and attentive. Drinks were always full, fries were always being refilled. Great waiter. The burgers were delicious. At least I though so at first. I had the jalapeno burger and my boyfriend had the guacamole bacon burger. So why the one star?  Well......everything was great until we got home. About 2-3 hours after dining I started getting the most intense cramps I've ever felt. The doubled-over-in-the-fetal-position-on-the-bed-yelling-DON'TTOUCHME kind of cramps. Followed by the fact that I was extremely nauseous and extremely sick (I won't go into further icky details but you get the point) and sweating profusely to the point where it made me strip down into little more than a vest and some undies (and i was still overheating at that point!) My boyfriend had similar  effects but to a lesser degree.  Probably my first and last time at R.R

Don't normally have bad things to say about this place but the service is pretty awful and the lack of recording orders showed. First our drink order was wrong and that was because our waitress didn't write any our order down. Then we order and one of our orders came out with the wrong cheese on the burger so they took it back which was nice. Then we get the order back and we find out that all they did was tear the cheese off because there was still cheese on the bottom of the bun and then to top it all off, when we got it back, the sandwich was chicken, not beef, which it was before. And our waitress seemed very put out that there were issues. And then argued with us about what we ordered. Don't think I'll be coming back here again.

The only red robin branch my family and I go to. Went there today at around 3-4ish pm and had the best server, JORDAN K. Very friendly, helpful, funny, and keeps track of all his work! Made sure to ask which sauces we wanted, reminded us to present our red robin card upon payment. Remembered which dessert we wanted. Outstanding service! Thank you Jordan! We will be back and ask for you again!
Complete 180 from my last visit. Service was relatively quick and the food came out quick.

My friend and I were starving and this was the restaurant that was closest to Target so we decided to eat here.  I've eaten at a few Red Robins before and my experience has always been ok, until I ate at this one.  This has got to be the worst Red Robin EVER.  The bar was practically empty when we walked in, but our bartender took forever to get to us.  The menu that he gave us was dirty, the bartop was dirty, the whole place just seemed really run-down and dingy.  The food was sub-par and most of the servers (including the bartender) were either texting or gathered around the corner talking to each other. I'm just glad I didn't get food poisoning.  Never coming back here again.

I've been to the Glendale Galleria countless times especially as a kid growing up, but I never experienced dining in at Red Robin until today. Today we got dinner.. And a show. The show consisted of the fire that was started up outside of the building when there neon sign burst into flames. Seems that the "E" in "RED" caught fire maybe due to a short circuit. The chaos and pandemonium of all the employees running around holding extinguishers had the customers wondering what was up... and before you know it, we and 4 other tables were told to move to another booth since the fire marshall requested they evacuate one side of restaurant for our safety. It was all good, we picked up our drinks and moved along.. the only thing that was on my mind was "these 10 dollar burgers better be worth it". Soon after, LAFD arrived and put out the weak flames.  On to the food.. I ordered the shroom swiss burger.. she asked how would I like it cooked.. so of course "medium". I like my beef juicy and a tad bit rare in the center. The burger was great and comparable to the Hula burger they offer at Islands, but here they don't mess around and use a massive amount of shrooms which I definitely enjoyed. The best way I can put it is that the slices of shrooms were stacked inside the burger like poker chips (it was assembled perfectly, I know, I should have taken a pic, but that's what happens when your starving and way too excited) ... they had to have used at least 10 whole mushrooms for each burger. TERRIFIC!  They also come with bottomless steak fries which were also great. An extra half star (3.5) for having a seasoned salt shaker on each table... Its always good when you can add as much salt seasoning goodness on your fries as you please. I also thought that I would be able to devour at least 3 baskets of fries, but after the first batch you could have stuck a fork in me cause I was done. Of course each of us still ordered another batch of fries because it's a must when you know there bottomless and that was another reason why I wanted to try this place out.

So upset... All I wanted was to so is order to take out. One of the waiters asked what I want and I told him my order and when other customers came in behind me he says sorry I will need to seat this people down Steven will help you.... After standing for over 10 minutes waiting for Steven or some other waiter to approach me the same waiter returns because there are other people behind me again and instead of 1st saying I'm sorry did Steven take your order... He says good evening ladies and was about to walk away when I said 'sorry but is anyone going to help me'? He say I told you Steven will help you-Steven at the Bar and I told you 3 times' pointing his 3 fingers out to me!!! OMG!!!! Really? I said 'u never said to go to the bar'.As if I know who Steven is!!! Bad customer service. I was treated very poorly and felt like I was a NO body just because I was taking out and not dining in. The fact that Steven ended up helping me with my order which I ordered a good amount worth I ended up tipping Steven pretty well for being nice and taking my order. I will no longer done out or ever eat at this Red robin location ever again.

So for me and my boyfriend's 7 year anniversary we wanted to go somewhere we have never been before. This was the spot, after a while of shopping we decided to get our grub on! this place was pretty busy but I got to say for being as busy as they were the service was fast and excellent. Our waitress was so kind and attentive to our needs. As for the food it was sooooo yummy, I got a bacon cheeseburger with everything on the side and it was great my boyfriend ended up getting the berserker burger at least I think that's how it spelled and he loved it. I really don't understand all the negative reviews on here because my experience was great and I would definitely come back. I think the only thing that really bothered me was the lady in front of us, some people had accidentally left there Abercrombie bag at there table and this lady had the nerve to slide the bag over to her look through it and put it back ARE YOU KIDDING ME! Other than that I loved it. Also you can't beat the bottomless fries...where else can you get that? Nowhere I can think of, And its FREE definitely can't beat that nowhere no how! See ya soon Red Robin..you have won me over!!

Friendly people, great service, great food. The manager is super nice & re-made our food without us asking because we pre-ordered and took too long to get to the restaurant. (all during lunch time)...Great first time. I'll definitely be back. :)

Casual dining with my wife and 3 grandchildren on a night that was overflowing with shoppers. The Hostess was professional and cool under pressure of at least six restless toddlers.  Denise, our server, was excellent and remained cool despite the crowd.  The food was excellent.  My wife and I will definitely return,
Awesome!  try the Blue ribbon burger or the Whiskey river! aaarrrh i get hungry thinking about theme!

I've been here twice before my last visit and it's always sub-par and what you'd expect from a chain restaurant, so when my friend wanted to come here for lunch I definitely wasn't excited. We were seated at the bar while a table of employees were sitting behind us eating. There was no bartender behind the bar although we could see lots of employees wandering around the restaurant. We waited for about 10 minutes without being greeted by any of the 10+ employees we saw on the floor. We finally decided waiting any longer was ridiculous so we left. I'm kind of happy that happened because I didn't want to eat there anyway but it was pretty terrible service to not even be greeted while a table of employees sat behind us laughing it up. I will not be returning for the mediocre food and terrible service.

Ok, I'm not a fan of chain restaurants, but I have to admit, I kinda like this place :P I like the burger and the price is pretty reasonable. And of course, who doesn't like the strawberry lemonade drinks, very refreshing ;)

BRING BACK THE MT. OLYMPUS BURGER! We decided to go here on one of the hottest days last year but that didn't phaze us one bit. We saw advertisements for the Mt. Olympus burger everywhere so we decided to go even though it's unlike us to go to a chain restaurant inside a mall. (Subliminal messages anyone?) But boy, am I glad I made that decision. The service wasn't that good. We ordered bottomless drinks but the waitress avoided our section of the restaurant after our 4th refill. Bottomless, MY BADONKADONK. All that really matters is that the Mt. Olympus burger did not disappoint. It had a patty, spinach-artichoke dip, bacon, feta cheese, tomatoes, and lettuce. It was so good.... bring it back!

The service at this location is sloooowwwww. But as a chain, their Banzai and Royal Burgers are consistently good; and unlimited steak fries with their seasoning salt and honey mustard dressing will always keep this place in a location adjacent to my heart.
The drinks here are good and the food is average. It's typical chain restaurant fare. The decor has some random kitsch and some cool things on it's wall. Not much more I can add to this review!

food was alright and service was nothing really to complain about...BUT...when i asked about substituting fries, the server said there was a 99cent upcharge for a salad/onion rings/fruit.  So what the heck I substituted my fries for fruit.  When my burger came out, my "side" of fruit consisted of 2 slices of cantaloupe. wth...really? REALLY? 2 slices? thats it?  wow, i got worked!

Horrible horrible service. I was planning on using saving my free burger on my Royalty card, but I decided what the hell, and use it here. (Usually in San Diego). After coming in, hostess mindlessly talks to her friend ON THE JOB for 5 mintues while we stand next to her waiting to get seated. She directs us to a table we disliked and we asked to switch. She responds that there's no server for the other table but then offers up the table to a party of 3 a few minutes later compared to our party of 7. Took the time to count, waiter was decent, I believe she was offended by one of my friends remarks but she didn't purposely try to ruin our service. Burgers took at least 10 minutes to come and it wasn't even busy at the time. While eating, we asked for more baskets of Bottomless fries and they took forever to come. ( At the SD one I've been too, they would have been here instantly.) I ordered the A1 peppercorn burger for the first time. Honestly.. it felt like I was eating meat from a microwavable pizza. It was tasteless and just had no flavor at all. I ended up picking at it while waiting for the infinity time it took for the bottomless fries to come. Friend ordered the burning love burger and from personal experience, it isn't a great choice either. NOT spicy and the whole burger just ends up kinda soggy. If it wasn't for the free burger, I wouldn't have been here. LOVE the Red robin Franchise, just not this particular one. Fun fact: We were in the middle of the place and a fly kept hovering around my food.

I got a turkey burger on ciabatta bread and it was delicious!! :) It also comes with bottomless fries which are really good! The waiter was a little weird in the beginning. No emotions just blank face and it felt awkward...but overall good experience

Over-priced! Go to Islands if you're in the mood for that type of 'corporate, yummy burger' business. I guess the one advantage is the bottomless steak fries, but GEEZ LOUIS, with the amount of the burger and the amount of steak fries, how much can you really it? HOW MUCH?!?! Our server was friendly.  The place was empty. It was the middle of the week.  I've said it once, and I'll say it again: ISLANDS! ISLANDS! ISLANDS! ISLANDS!

I used to be a big fan. The bottomless steak fries with that special seasoning was awesome. I enjoyed the guilty pleasure of the calories I was consuming. And then? I realized I was over it. Red Robin is fine, but in the end it's better-than-average suburbia food. There's no shortage of actual gourmet burgers in LA. Why was I driving all the way to Glendale for Red Robin? I do like the decor of the place and it beats mall food, but it's just not special.

So...red robin pretty much has the best steak fries around. With the honey mustard its the golden combination and I am not one to ever say no!  I can go through a basket plus by myself. Pretty easily considering they're heaven on earth to my tummy The burgers here are insane. They're large and packed with toppings. The whiskey river sans bacon with boca burger is one of my favorites, but i have to have not eaten all day to even attempt eating this one. Usually i order the kids boca burger and i'm a happy camper. So much food and i'm crawling out of there The staff is very helpful and friendly!

Place is good  Server was good  Food was really not good I don't know if only me but I didn't like it at all specially Cesar salad it was so bad like if u buy  some lettuce and Cesar dressing from Ralph's and u mix it will be way better .. Wish u good luck guys

The server was quite lively and friendly introducing herself in the beginning and let us know about their happy hour offerings.  However, the same isn't to be said about the service during our meal.  Did not check on us during our whole meal, even though she kept passing our table.  We had to flag the server down for napkins, utensils, more "bottomless" fries, drink refills, etc.  However, the burger I got was quite delicious, and you should ask for the garlic parmesan fries instead of the normal fries.  Its free to substitute, and WAY better than the original fries.  Good atmosphere for drinks, but expect subpar service.  Overall, just a mediocre experience.

Unlimited fries. Why hello there! So why can't we have unlimited soup as well? Why? I ordered the Burnin' Love just because the description made my mouth water: "You'll get fired up for the crisply fried jalapeño coins, tangy salsa and spicy Pepper-Jack cheese layered on top of our cayenne-seasoned burger. It's topped with lettuce and fresh tomatoes to cool things off and served on a jalapeño-cornmeal kaiser roll with chipotle mayo"  Burnin' Love you are a total lie. Not spicy at all.I should have asked for more jalapenos' and hot sauce.
Happy hour deals from 3:00-6:00 and 8:00-10:00pm. $2.50 16oz draft and $3.50 24oz draft beer. Love this place. I always receive great service. Cool place to hang out while drinking and eating

Went to Glendale galleria  and I have not been to this Red Robin.  Is a great please to eat in between shopping. Love their chicken salads and burgers. A little sad the took of the south west grilled chicken salad but they have lots more to choose from

Worst Service.  We had to wait 20 minutes for waitress to come to our table.   Finally ordered drinks and food.  We had to wait another 15 minutes for our drinks to arrive.  Terrible service and lacked respect for customers.  Will never go to this Red Robin in Glendale Galleria.  Thumbs down!

That onion tower is what dreams are made of.  Good burgers, alright service, amazing milkshakes.... I guess it all evens out to be a 3. Tacky, yes, but sometimes you need a little declasse eats to keep you grounded. The last time I went service was slow slow slow, but I think since it was such a slow afternoon and we were in the corner, we were being pretty easy to ignore.

Very nice and delicious burgers , but very slow service . The waiters are terrible . We came on a monday noon , there was couple of tables only ... We waited for 15 mins for the waiter to show up ... And we left

Despite it being a greasy pit stop sat the mall, the upside is you get what you expect plus more!   I expected a quick meal - I got that.  i expected a not so healthy meal - I got that.  What I didn't expect was such a family friendly restaurant - including a diaper changing pad in the women's restroom plus a smaller sink version for the kids and a lower toilet in one stall (though it was still quite big).  I also did not expect the wait staff to be so friendly and actually check on our water, especially from prior reviews.  Guess they went online and read the reviews, realizing their tips would be hurt if they didn't get their act together.  Or.. maybe it depends on where you sit and who your waiter is.  We had the nice Asian guy (not trying to be biased here but he really was attentive and friendly and must have been serving a TON of tables with how much he was walking around).   The best part was the bottomless steak fries are also bottomless sweet potato fries... I do wish they had syrup but it ain't no Yardhouse and with how many kids are in this joint, I'd hate for the booths to be sticky plus greasy from leftover maple syrup (hellOoooo IHOP).   Lastly - LOVE that they were able to accommodate our baby's stroller sitting next to us instead of making us check it in the front (shame on you CPK!).  Our stroller is pretty nice ... so that made me happy, and baby was happy to sleep in it while we ate instead of in our arms.

I'm not a big fan of chains, but if I'm at a mall and have to choose something chainy, I'll choose Red Robin. For starters, it's consistent and the food is good - it's solid for what it is. Second, the service is outstanding. This place reminds me of my high school years up in Washington State where this chain originated. Red Robin was THE place to go to for birthday dinners and after football games. In the last 15-20 years, I've probably eaten the entire menu between here and Seattle. Some of my favorites: - Clucks and Fries, Buffalo Style - Red Robin Royal Burger - Banzai Burger - Crispy Chicken Tender Salad - Spinach Artichoke Dip I like to drown my fries in the Red Robin Seasoning. Yum. The mixed drinks are tasty but they're a bit stingy with the alcohol - probably to keep it a family-friendly place, which is totally understandable. The service is recognizably awesome. The staff is super nice and extremely attentive but not in the annoying way. I love this place for nostalgic reasons but it's also a great place to eat!

My bf wanted to try this place out, so I went along with it. Apparently in Ohio, they have good burgers.  The decor was very similar to what you would see in a normal chain restaurant, very similar to Applebees, but admittedly slightly nicer, and more spacious.  My bf ordered a coke, and I ordered a skinny margarita. The skinny margarita was great. For $6.49 it was a pretty nice drink.  We ordered the nachos as an appetizer, which where reasonably priced, and I did like that they separated our order into two plates for us, but on the other hand, the nachos where kinda dry. Not the worst nachos in the world, but not the best. Next came our actual entrees, I ordered the Red Robin Gourmet Cheeseburger with sweet potato fries, and my bf ordered the Burnin' Love Burger with steak fries. Both our burgers were cooked medium, and we both agreed, that for what they were, we'd rate them a 6 out of 10. They aren't your typical fast food burgers, but somewhere around the realm of diner style burgers. I'm not sure I would call them "Gourmet" but they were good. Our server brought over some water for me, which was a plus since I hadn't even asked for a water. The manager then walked around with the kitchen chef and asked if our meal was ok. It was a little awkward since I tried to compliment the food, but the chef seemed so annoyed that he had to do this. Our server had weird timing, and appeared in complete dismay when my bf said he didn't want another coke. I personally would have just brought the new soda over, seeing how I now find out at HOME that his soda was unlimited. We specifically asked him in the beginning what the drink specials were. I figured that if they had unlimited refills of soda, that would be one of the first things mentioned when asked about drink specials. He could have taken the menu and recommended one or two or his favorites, and directed us to where we could find more information, but he didn't. He also didn't ask if I had wanted another drink, more fries (aren't they supposed to be bottomless?) or if we even wanted desert. He just placed the check on the table, proceeded to occasionally walk by and glance at our plates. At first I thought, well maybe the poor guy just wants to go home and its the end of his shift, but then I over heard that he was infact one of the closers for the evening. With your section not being full, the restaurant not being packed, and you being one of the closers of the evening, having more then enough time....why rush us?  We also sat right next to one of the servers computer systems, which my bf and I got to occasionally hear the servers gather /huddle over and gossip about the customers. Maybe this wouldn't have happened, if Red Robin had a manager that focused more on his staff  then forcing his chef to prance around the restaurant begrudgingly. Our meal came out to $40 and though our server lacked in some ways, he did check back on us occasionally, and seemed sincere when asking if our meals where ok, so having been a server myself (back in the day) I decided that he must well intentioned but somehow inexperienced even though they apparently have him as a closer. I left him 20%, which put our meal at $48-49.  My advice, come here during happy hour, and only during happy hour, otherwise it is completely not worth it. This place is between 2-3 stars. Three for the happy hour specials and the alright food.

We love Red Robin, especially the Glendale Galleria location. They are consistent with good food quality and service. Awesome burgers, try the Burning Love with turkey patty. Clam Chowder is good. Kid friendly place, it a nice to be able to bring the little one, still have a beer and watch sports. Tends to get busy on weekends, but they text you while you shop. Oh yeah - do get the royalty rewards card if you frequently come here.

Under normal circumstances, I would give this 4/5 stars!  But lately the service and quality at this particular Red Robin has been on a decline.  I usually call in and pick up my order, and the occasional dipping sauce or extra cheese being forgotten didn't really bother me.  But today not only did they forget the extra cheese, the dipping sauce, AND gave me the wrong fries, they ALSO didn't cook the burger long enough -I usually like med rare meat, but not on a burger!  It was the "red" in Red Robin and it was disgusting. I tried to call to talk to a manager, but they put me on hold for such a long time that I ended up hanging up and calling back.  This time I waited for awhile before someone told me that they were too busy to talk to me, and I should call back another time.  I told them about my burger so they made sure it didn't happen to someone else, and they just curtly replied "sorry" before hanging up.  They didn't even offer to make it up to me. If you plan on eating inside you can at least make sure they get your order correct, so here's what I recommend: Garden Burger: Only this burger has the Garden Burger patty -if you substitute any other meat patty for a vegetable one, they'll use a Boca Burger patty because it's cheaper, which doesn't taste the same. Whiskey River BBQ Burger:  Personally I don't like all of those onion straws, so I ask to replace them with their "angry onions" instead.  I think they're healthier anyway. Lone Star Burger:  You notice that this isn't on their menu.  It used to be popular 10 years ago, and most of the chefs remember how to make.  If you ask nicely they'll usually make it.  I forgot all that's on it, but I remember it does had pepper jack cheese and jalapenos! Spicy Clucks and Fries:  These strips are so spicy you can smell them coming!  Delicious though -just make sure you have a drink around and plenty of ranch or blue cheese dressing to cut down that crazy sauce! Speckled Lemonade:  Strawberry peach lemonade with chunks of frozen strawberries in it, and served in a fun swirly glass!  Yum. Garlic Parmesan Fries:  Sooo much better than their regular fries -covered in pieces of garlic, shaved parmesan cheese and parsley!  I prefer to dip them in blue cheese dressing! Great place for kids and groups, and the prices are worth the amount of food you get!  The fries and drinks are bottomless too!  Also they have a great website where you can customize your burger, and it will tell you how many calories it will have!  The high calorie count is shocking, but don't beat yourself up too much......you can make it up to yourself by having salads the rest of the week.  ;) FYI:  Stay away from the clam chowder -it's nasty.

I went here for lunch today and it was amazing brian the bartender was our server and he was excellent joked around with us had a good laugh and made sure we had everything we needed its always my go to place when I need a lil escape from work on my lunch

I'm a fan of chain restaurants just as much as hole-in-the-wall establishments. There is something about knowing whichever chain restaurant you go to, you'll find that very same menu item you love and are craving.  Red Robin is definitely one of my faves for burgers. This particular location gets 5 stars based on their amazing service. I think the managers and servers here go above and beyond, and thats what customers love.  Go eat....Reeeeeeeeed Robin!!!!
