Ever wonder what having dinner in hell would be like? Wonder no more because the Glendale Gallaria Red Robin is here. While you wait for slow, bad service you can enjoy sweating in an unexplaibably hot dinning area, overhear moron servers ask the bartender if whiskey gets a lime, and try to figure out how ketchup and other condiments have avoided be cleaned or wiped down since they arrived (seriously some gross stuff on everything). When you order a wedge salad don't expect more than two small blue cheese crumbles and hardly any dressing. Thebirger come with bottomless fries, fries so soggy and bland you'll be dumping the Red Robin Signature Blend Seasoning all over them just to pretend they're edible. I would go on about what's wrong but need to put my phone down and do some crazy dance in order to get the check to me before I've been here long enough to sweat out all the liquid in my body.

I went to red robin and had not good service... Posted a review on yelp. Someone contacted me right away and are sending me a gift card. The fact any business took time to even call me is so great!! Management is so awesome here! Especially sherwin! Thank you guys again :)
I like this Red Robins. The staff is always friendly and very helpful and my burger always comes out hot and delicious.

I used to come here a lot when I first moved to LA because it was close to target and at the mall. We have stopped coming here as much because the food is whatever and we were just not pleased with the wait staff. We are familiar with the waiters and we think that this place is understaff and the waiters have this thing about walking away as you are talking to them??? I didn't believe it when my gf mentioned it but then she asked the waiter for a refill on water and he started to walk away as she was finishing her question... odd huh? Anyways... it's convenient to come here because it's in the mall but if I had a choice... I probably wouldn't.

Horrible service. Horrible food. Waited a long time for our waiter & he didn't show. Finally asked another waiter to take our order. Then, waited a super long time for our food. When our waiter made an appearance, we were like "who are you?" He didn't ask to refill our drinks, fries or if we needed anything. When food came, the hamburgers were very small. Came with a small cup of fries. Bill was given quickly after we received the food. It was incorrect. I wasn't given a chance to order dessert. Then, took forever for waiter to give us the corrected bill. Will never come here again.

It was my boyfriend's nephew's birthday and he wanted his uncle to take him out to lunch. We asked him why he wanted to go to Red Robin, and he said "because they give you ice cream for your birthday!" Too cute. When we got there, we got seated right away. My boyfriend and I weren`t in the mood for burgers at the time, but I ended up getting the Guacamole Bacon Burger (minus bacon), my boyfriend got the Prime Rib Dip, and his niece and nephew both got the kids pizza with apples. What I love about Red Robin is that their big steak fries are bottemless, so the fries are always coming. My Guacamole Burger was okay. It was cooked nicely medium with a pink center so it was juicy, however the guacamole was missing something. I couldn`t even tell that it was there. My boyfriend`s Prime Rib Dip was good. I actually liked it better than what I ordered. The sandwich had sliced prime rib that was tender and juicy, with carmelized onions and provolone cheese. It also comes with an au jus dipping sauce. Dipping the sandwich in the au jus makes it all better because the baguette absorbed the au jus. Yum. The kids seem to enjoy their pizza very much. They ate everything. The kids meals come with a small kids drink that are bottemless as well. After we finished our meal, the waiter brought over an ice cream sundae and sang happy birthday to my boyfriend`s nephew. He didn`t enjoy the singing, he just wanted the ice cream. Haha..

This was my first red robin experience and I was thrilled! Love the food selection, and the atmosphere was cool! I had the burnn' love burger. It wasn't too spicy, tons of flavor. My mom had the prime rib dip which was pretty good, and we shared an order of onion rings which were delicious! WIll return again.

I ordered some sort of chicken burger which was yummy! The service was prompt, and the waitress was nice. I just didn't really care for their fries, maybe because they looked and tasted like they where like the last bits n pieces left at the bottom of the bag. I'll definitely bring my appetite back to this place again, and just get onion rings instead of their fries.

First let me just say ignore all the negative reviews if you've never been here. My girlfriend and I entered the establishment and were seated very promptly. Our section was packed with people, but our waitress (Stephanie) did very well for having so many tables to attend to. I ordered the Berserker Burger, which is/was a promotional item for the movie 'The Wolverine' . My girlfriend ordered the Bacon Cheeseburger. Both came with endless fries. After a short wait the food arrived. We were not disappointed. The burgers can be ordered well done or medium-well. I ordered my meat well done and my girlfriend ordered the latter option. I'm definitely going back. They lived up to their jingle for sure! Also, expect a higher noise level than your average eatery because it's located in a mall.

I might have picked a day and time when service there was crummy. It didn't take long for us to receive our drinks. My sons food (kids pizza and fruit) came rather quickly but as for mine and my friends, it took a long long long time. We had already went through two refills and didn't understand why our food was taking so long. I told my friend "do you think she forgot to bring us our food and it's probably just sitting under heat lamps?"  He waved the server down and when she saw him, she knew "oh ya there food!!"  So she went to the kitchen and came back with our food that was obviously under heat lamps. The fries were under my fish and they were cold but the top of my fish were hot. So needless to say, the fries were gross. My fish were very greasy and mushy. My friends avocado burger had a smidgen of avocado which we found to be disappointing since it's an Avocado Burger. As we were eating our waitress never came back, just like she disappeared as we were waiting for our food. We had to ask another server for ranch and other stuff we needed. She finally came back to give me a box and check and once again she disappeared. Had the manager run my card and we left. It was incredibly disappointing being that we used to love Red Robin and that was our first time at that particular location. Def won't be going to this one in the future.

I have eaten here several times and have had nothing less than a great experience. I was just here a couple of days ago, and we were seated and served right away. I don't think I was in there for more than an hour. Their food is delicious and the servers are very kind. I did not have to ask for a refill once. I plan on coming back next time I am at the galleria.
Great place to go for burgers of all types with a wide selection of beers.

After a nice trip to the Glendale galleria.. we were in the quest of looking for some food. Tina, Christina, and i were starving! and we decided why not red robin. we sat down in a booth and the waiter was prompt in asking us for drinks. service at this place is awesome. Need a refill, they already got u. All 3 of us had the same thing in mind when it came to ordering some food. we all had the clucks and fries... gotta love that finger food. endless fries that we couldn't finish. Overall this place is pretty bomb! definite comeback soon. The drinks do look nice though. in their crazy cup and all. check this place after a good day of shopping at the mall. no regrets enjoi.

Oh my gosh, what the heck happened with this place? The fries were pretty subpar the last time I was there. Not only were they soggy, but did they taste like potato bricks. The burger was okay, but I was not impressed this time as opposed to the past. I felt like I just got slapped in the face this time. Slapped in the face and got told "F*ck you." Slapped in the face, got told "F*ck you", and lost 30 bucks. Disappointing.

Good for the price. Even though prices seem to be going up. Burgers are good. Waitress was damn slow! The people behind me were complaining about lots of fly's i did see one around out food, which is disturbing! Should be 2 stars....

me and my son went here recently, but im just now writing my feelings down. this place sucks. the hostess showed us to our table which was a mess. the table was wiped down, because all the crap was pushed on the seats. we had to wait forever for our waitress to even order, once we did, we sat there waiting for our drinks. then were told that there was a shift change and got another waitress, but the service stayed the same, shitty! our food came out and she basically threw the food down and left. the burgers were ok (not gourmet like they say), but it was already too late to make things up. i asked for our check and had to wait again. we'll never go back here, shitty place from top to bottom. we left and my son told me that he thought the people were rude....he has the makings of a future yelper.

I was not impressed by their customer service.  I signed up for one of their royalty cards and activated it the day I went in for lunch.  After finishing they scanned my card and said I wasn't able to get the free burger I had come in for because there was a 24 hour wait time after activation (After going back I checked, it does say this on the website, but is hard to find and not on the main page).  Especially, considering it was their birthday promotion I would think they would overlook this technicality.  I talked to 2 managers and they insisted I pay in full, even though the only reason i came in was because of the deal.  They were not very sympathetic.  I wouldnt have cared much if the burger was good, but it was pretty mediocre.  I preferred the guacamole burger at Carls Jr. over the one they had, so it wasnt worth it. Another time when I tried to come here they said the wait would be 10 minutes.  After 25 I checked in with them and they had accidentally skipped us.  Instead of apologizing and making up for their mistake, they said it would be another 10 minutes so we left.

POOR SERVICE! Went there on a saturday, the place was half empty. Our server was pathetic. She forgot our fries and we waited until she came back. By the time she came back our burger was cold. A burger taste better when its complimented with fries. The quality is also poor. The burger is bland. I asked for medium and it came well done. The basket the burger was in also came with fries. There were approximately 8 fries in the basket. Bottomless fries my ass. The fries are missing from the bottom and if there are any, it is exceptionally less from what is expected.

I never thought I would ever eat at a Red Robin, and this one in particular, because when I was a child we were at this mall and the Red Robin mascot stalked us all the way to the other side!  (In hindsight, I can almost talk myself into believing the person had just gotten off work and was heading to their car, but then I remember that he/she was in costume the entire length of the mall, so there was definitely something sinister going on :/)  But my friend and I were both craving burgers, and she wanted to eat at a Red Robin.  I looked up the menu online and it wasn't too bad so I decided to give it a try. She got the mushroom burger (something 'Shroom?) and I got the Bleu Ribbon burger.  Hers looked gross hahahahaha.  Granted, it didn't look all too appetizing on the website, but it looked a lot worse in person, I couldn't even look at it while I was eating :D.  On the other hand, mine was awesome :D.  I asked for medium well, and while I don't know enough to be able to tell if it was actually medium well, it wasn't overcooked (the first time I ever ordered a non-fast food burger I asked for "VERY well done" and it could've been used as a hockey puck) or undercooked (to me that means it doesn't look raw and definitely no oozing blood if I poked at it).  I loved how they cooked the onions (I don't really like onions, especially raw), I think they called it onion straws, they were like thinner and more lightly battered versions of onion rings.  The bun it was on was also really good, it was nice and soft too, definitely felt and tasted fresh. Our server was nice, he came by quite often to ask how everything was, but in a very polite manner that didn't make you want to scream "stop bothering us!" (I've had waiters who would refill your glass every time you drank more than an inch from the rim -______-  made me feel like they just wanted to eavesdrop on the conversation). They also had unlimited fries!  I didn't know that until the server asked if we wanted more fries, but by that time I was pretty stuffed.  I think the fries had more of a wedge shape (I prefer my fries in a stick shape lol, they just feel more like fries that way), I don't remember much else about them because I drenched them in ketchup :D, though I don't think they were dry, because no amount of ketchup can save fries that are dry.  Next time I'm going to eat all my fries first and get refills :D. I definitely want to eat at Red Robin again, if only to confirm this experience wasn't a fluke.  I want to try a chicken sandwich next time, and their cod sandwich too (I can't decide if it sounds delicious or if it sounds like a bad idea :D - it might be a better idea to just get fish and chips).  I also want to try their Cobb salad (I love Cobb salad), but I don't know if it's a good idea to get salad at a restaurant that prides itself on burgers.

Red Robin is great for a mall meal. The service has always been a bit slower than I like, but when cruising around the mall, I dont mind as much. They serve a great burger and their Clucks and Fries (Buffalo Style) make me come back! Best buffalo tenders around. Unlimited fries with your meal. Root beer float is also unlimited.

I'll be honest: I pretty much only go to Red Robin once a year, when it's time to redeem my free birthday burger.  This is one of the best birthday freebies out there! They used to email you a printable coupon, but now they have a physical "Red Royalty" card that's loaded with your free birthday burger and other rewards.  You have the entire month of your birthday to redeem your free burger. Each time I've been here, the service has been nice and friendly.  The burgers are all good, and who doesn't love bottomless fries? I just wish they hadn't gotten rid of their garlic parmesan fries.  Those were delicious!

My girlfriend and I came to red Robin after a 3 mile hike at griffin park..  We had Burger fries strawberry lemonaid waiter by the name of Derek or Dennis who was absolutely fabulous :) I would drive all the way out here again, the food was delicious drinks were good and good service!
I had the bacon/guacamole burger with a strawberry milkshake. All I have to say was the burger was BLAH and the milkshake, well ive had better.

They are not very organized. When we checked in they told us it would be 15 min or so but we could go to the bar and find a table. We walk to the bar and all the tables are dirty, they hadn't cleaned them yet. We stood there and no one of the workers bothered to ask us anything. Finally my fiancé asked a waitress and she told us that she's didn't know of they were busy or not and told is to go to the check in desk, (Mind you they have 2 check in desks) so we went to the one closer to us. We walked back and  hostess #1 was like oh will sit you right now. Waited 10 min and other people who walked in after us got seated before us, at the bar and at a regular booth. We were about to loose it when another party walked in and the hostess # 2 started walking them to sit them. Then hostess #1 stopped her and came and got us. The food wasn't that good but our waiter was really nice and attentive. He was probably the best part of that whole experience.

REALLY FAST EVERYTHING!! From being seated to getting our food. Service was really fast! I liked it! But at the same time it was kind of like we were being rushed. Our server would check up on us a couple times. Very nice. Love the food

Although my brother seems to love this place, can't say it's one of my favorite burger places. Pretty much everything I've tried is not too memorable, kind of like burgers and sandwiches from Denny's or some similar place.  Pretty much the only reason I gave it 3 stars was that the last time I went a few weeks ago, the server was pretty great. That was nice, since the women at the door were kind of snooty, especially when my party asked for a booth instead of a table. The server was a young guy who was super friendly and really attentive, making sure to check in, make sure our cups were full, and even let us order nacho fries (we exchanged fries for the chips in some special cheeseburger nachos that were on the menu). :)

This place definitely has great tasting burgers and amazingly delicious onion rings. However, It is an expensive lunch experience. For $16 I ate a Blue Ribbon burger, 10 french fries, and 3 onion rings (shared within a group). Once the lunch tab surpasses that $15 mark it's hard not to think about the classier food that money could have bought.

I ate at Red Robin's with my brother Friday evening, Nov.02, it  was the last hour for business when we stopped in, it's located in the Glendale Galleria.  I was disappointed with the service received, and the attitudes of the male waiters there.  They hang around talking with each other about their personal lives affairs, all while patrons waited for menus.  We must of waited 10 minutes, and the restaurant had few patrons.  Our waiter walked quickly past us and said as he walked past our table, "I'll be right with you".  Meanwhile he was on the side with the other male waiters just chit chatting about their personal affairs.  When he finally came to our table, I asked for water with lemon, he came back with water and one tiny sliver of lemon he had squeezed with with hand that had just priorly been cleaning tables and handling money from tips picked up at tables, in which he then dropped the sliver of lemon in my water.  It's been a very long time since I've seen any restaurant do that.  For sanitary reasons, the lemon slices are served in a small side dish along with the glass of water.   These waiters seem to be a lot more preoccupied with discussing their personal lives with each other and ignoring service to their patrons.  I wasn't comfortable with the staff and I questioned their sanitary habits with food handling.  Although their menu looked decent, I'll never go to that particular location again.
Burger was gigantic, we expected shrimp/chicken entrée to be a little bigger for the price and the booth could of been a little cleaner, including the lamp above. Service was great!
No matter what your burger is always fully cooked not medium rare. That being said, the meat is ok, which makes the burger just ok. Nothing special, nothing to write home about.

If I could give this place no stars I would. Waited about 20 minutes before a waiter actually came and gave us water, another 10 minutes for someone to take our order, waited another 25 minutes and food wasn't even out. Service here is unbelievable and I would never come back. I asked for the check and they couldn't even bring that to me, I just paid for my drink and left. I wasn't about to stay another 30 minutes for a burger and bad service. My recommendation is to go to the food court and get something there! Went to Stone Oven for a sandwich and it totally made up for this disappointment.

My friend and I came in here to celebrate "OMG it's DONE!" - meaning her state licensing exam for cosmetology.  Our requirements were: a) booze and b) food.  So we popped in here. I'd never been to a RR before, and for being typical chain restaurant food, it wasn't bad.  I'm not one of those people who can't stand chains.  I actually like a lot of them.  At RR, our service was quick, friendly, and didn't get messed up in any way.   My friend and I both got margaritas - hers on the rocks, mine frozen.  Both were enjoyed thoroughly.  We split the spinach artichoke dip and the crispy chicken salad.  The little breads that come with the salad are delicious, by the way.  My friend liked the garlic breads that came with the dip - since I'm allergic to garlic, I stuck with the chips. Overall, not too shabby.   We left RR to head back to the testing facility so that she could find out if she passed - which she did!  I've already reviewed her work that she's done on me, as a student at the Paul Mitchell School in San Diego.

OK, they do have our fave waiter, Brandon, working here, so we have to upgrade the rating just for his service. We finally went back recently (the kids were BEGGING HARD). Better service because we asked for Brandon. All the other servers still standing around avoiding their customers, though. They did stock some Sweet N Low (I'm happy!) and their burgers are still good.

Go for the burger, any burger.  I got a grilled chicken sandwich thinking I was being healthy, but I was wrong.  Instead I sat across from my friend salivating over her cheeseburger. They have a nutritional content menu right on the table.  I didn't see it until after we ordered. The waiters are friendly.  They bring you water after every sip.

i looooove thre fries here. which is weird for me, cause i always go for the skinny, "non-steak" fry. but theyre soooooo good here. especially when theyre saturated in grease and dipped in the honey poppyseed dressing. SRSLY, if youre getting chicken strips or fries, GET HONEY POPPYSEED DRESsING TO DIP. i recommed the whisky river bbq burger, clucks n fries, and... actually thats all ive ever eaten here. but ive been a million times and the food is always great! the ambiance is horrid, and the music is also horrid. but when youve been shopping all day, and all you want is a big glass of diet coke and a booth to shove all your bags in, red robin will always be there!

Sometimes I just want a drink with my burger and Red Robin makes it happen! Like coming here sometimes to get a drink before I go shopping in the mall.  It takes the edge off having to walk through a mall full of  holiday shoppers!

Bar none, the best place to grab a bite to eat in the galleria. Service could not be any better, Thank you Walter! Cups were never empty, fries came fast, came to check up on us at least twice, super awesome attitude.
I usually like Red Robin, but this one sucked. Service was horrible. When we ordered our burgers, my girlfriends burger came with 3. YES THREE fries. ridiculous.

While shopping I stopped in for a quick lunch by myself. Ordered a Guac. Bacon Cheesburger and a water. The waiter was super nice and practically read my mind. I used to wait tables and so this is important to me.  He brought me more fries and ranch without even asking. Was great at filling my water. The burger was great, but the fries were undercooked both times. I like them a little crispy. They were warm, but not crisp. I guess I could have asked for them the way I liked them. Great service, and food pretty good. Not my favorite place, but did the job. Also noticed the server being that nice to all of his tables!

We waited 30 minutes for the food. We were already looking for the waiter to cancel until the food came. Water took soooooo long to come and our iced tea took a little while longer than the water. So while waiting, our waiter kept walking around trying to look busy but all he did was pace...kind of like he was in a rush. Now, I know that being a waiter/waitress is a difficult job so we did not want to bother him so much. But that's his job...to wait on you!!!! Once the food came it was all fine. Until!! We asked for a refil...that never came. We wanted ranch also so we asked for ranch...that came after all the food was done. We asked for bottomless fries that never came. After that we just wanted to leave...and waited...and waited...and waited until the check came. He grabbed that check like a hot potato. That was the fastest I've seen him the whole night. I only gave 2 stars for the food. Everything else is 0 stars. Also, a good way to judge the cleanliness of a restaurant's kitchen to me is the restroom...that gets NEGATIVE stars!!! Gagging just thinking about it!!!
not such a bad deal compared to the carl's jr. upstairs, plus you get a bar.
Food was decent, ordered a grilled chicken salad, burger, and chicken tenders.  The service was excellent!

Way back when, my husband and I used to really like this place.  But that was before we started exploring different restaurants that serve quality food.  We came here for lunch, and we both quickly realized how disgusting the food is!  And overpriced.  I got a chicken salad, which looked delicious in the picture.. but it was a bed of soggy lettuce, and dried out, overseasoned, gross chicken.  AND it cost $11!!! I didn't even want to finish it, it was so gross.. and ME not finish a salad is uncalled for.  I swear, the $5 salads at Jack in the Box is way better.  But hey, good thing I ordered a mint and chip shake, right? NOPE!... The shake tasted like mint medicine.  My husband ordered the Burnin Love Burger, and it was so salty.   The only positives here is the kids' menu.. my boys really like the kiddie food here.  The fries are good, and I do like the service... but honestly, next time I come to Glendale Galleria, I'm hitting up the food court!

Your typical kitschy burger place which is appropriately located inside a mall. The service is ok, the ambiance is painful, and the food is pretty good. I ordered the BBQ burger and hardly tasted the BBQ, but was still good. I stopped going to this place years ago but only went last night bc we had a giftcard. Overall it wasn't as bad as I remembered, but I still wouldn't willfully go here for a burger.

I'm kinda overdue on this review for Red Robin as it hasn't been the first time I've been to this place or any of the other RR places in SoCal.  We mainly come here because of it's family-friendly atmosphere, unlimited steak fries and drinks.   If memory serves me correctly, this was the first place where I had a burger that had a fried egg in it.  The Royal Red Robin burger has been a favorite of mine since. On my most recent visit, I decided to try something different.  I went with the Prime Rib dip which also included the unlimited garlic Parmesan fries.  Sad to say, I was pretty disappointed.  The prime rib meat was not only dry but it tasted pretty old.  Nothing "gourmet" about this prime rib at all, I felt like I was eating roast beef sandwich.  The garlic parmesan fries was pretty weak as well.  The garlic/parmesan looked nothing more than just a simple side garnish.  I was thinking the fries would be covered/seasoned but it wasn't.  It was like taking their usual steak fry and scooping the garlic/parmesan garnish like you would dipping a fry in ketchup.  Was it good?  If it wasn't for the fact that I liked anything garlic/parmesan, I would've never gotten it had I known that's what I was gonna get.  A mouthful of garlic isn't exactly what I had in mind either. Another common item we order is the creamy artichoke and spinach dip.  I have had this many times in the past and never had I had it this bad.  It was very bland and tasted like paste.  Nothing creamy about it.  It was nasty.  We actually made a comment about it (not a real complaint) and they ended up taking it off our bill which was nice.   It's not often that we come here but when we do we usually have a pretty good meal/experience.  This past visit was just plain bad.

So I frequent the Red Robin in Calabasas, and I decided to try out this location with my girlfriend. There were only a few other people eating here when we sat down. First, I have no idea who our waiter/waitress/dog/cat was, because after we ordered I dont think I saw her again.  The food came out slow and NOT HOT. It was obvious it sat for awhile, which is INSANE since it wasn't busy. I ordered a drink, which was great, but after I drank it, I sat with no water, or beverage for the rest of the meal. I couldn't find anyone to order another drink, or even get a water. I had to get my own ketchup from another table, and after we finished, it took us 20 mins to track down someone to get our check (not even our waitress).  We wanted a togo box, but we gave up on that... and the change for our bill ($5) was left as a tip since we just wanted to get out of there, instead of waiting for change. So maybe thats how the wait staff gets their tips, they give you such bad service that you end up leaving before getting your change back! I could understand if the place was busy, but it wasn't. The food was ok, but I know its better at the other location. We also overheard another waiter selling food like it was a late night info-commercial, which made us feel gross.  "So tell me what your favorite food is on the menu" -the fake waiter "Uhhh... the wings" -customer looking confused as he sits down "So let me put in a order of that for you..." "uhhh... no?" "Ok I understand, do you like Shrimp? " WTF????? Horrible service, cold food, and the feeling of being trapped at a chain restaurant sounds like a perfection combination for shopping.

So I came here for the very first time the other day, and my God it was amazing. The service was great, waiter was super nice and helpful (he even gave me a great recommendation) and the food was outstanding (endless fries man!). I had the Royal Red Robin... Most amazing burger I've ever eaten, period. Not even kidding, this burger could make the blind see, could make the lame walk, it was THAT great. My only complaint would have to be they give very little fries compared to every other dine in restaurant, but hey, that's why they're endless! All in all, everyone has to try Red Robin at least ONCE in their lifetime. You WON'T regret it!
food was good, the aura was dainty, first time there so I will re-evaluate

Deeelicious! My mouth is watering just from the thought of this place.  The freckled lemonade is beyond good. It has the perfect level of tang, combined with a bunch of yummy strawberry pieces.  Endless steak fries, and not just plain either. Nooo... Ask for the garlic Parmesan ones. OMG!!! Very garlicky, so you'll pee, poop and sweat the clove for two days, but it's worth it. All the food is really yummy, even the salads.  The apple crisp is a diabetics nightmare and so is the mud pie, but if I'm going to go into a coma, I want it to be from something that put a big ol' smile on my face.

"Where to?" "I don't know...I don't know what I want" "Red Robin" "Fine"  Normally all you can eat fat fries and the best strawberry lemonade I tasted so far would always be worth going to, but my red robing days in Glendale are long gone long gone...why? SERVICE The Glendale location has a funny L shape to it, but maintains the movie poster, funny pictures, colorful lampshades, colorful booths motif that RR has going for themselves. It doesn't take them long to seat you, and you start thinking about you want.  I love their Royal Red Robin Burger because of the fried egg that they put in it. Then there's the peppercorn thing...I would always get sauce on the side because you don't know how much of it you like in your burger, and I bet each of the short order cooks puts a different amount. After a while I started buying the same thing, The Turkey Burger!!  I was not very impressed with the meat quality on this either, but it was juicy enough to eat. The main course of the RR meal really isn't the burger though. I think of the burger as a buffer for the fries. Try the fries cooked crispy, if they do it right, it should feel like you're eating mashed potatoes that have been packaged in kettle chips.  So that is my take on the food, but back to the 2 star rating and the service. The last time I went there, the fries did not come out as good as I was used to, and each basket was worse than the previous one. It felt like each fry had given up on being tasty, and brought down the other fry's confidence. It also didn't help that the Honey Mustard ordered tasted like watered down water with a hint of horrible flavor.  Love Red Robin...but I will get my fix somewhere else.
UNLIMITED Garlic STEAK FRIES and bottom-less drinks I am there their menu changes up every other month or so with a new burger but the  unlimited fries and free refills for drinks brings me back

I LOVE going to Red Robyn!!!  This location has always been pleasant for me to visit with friends and family.  I enjoy it's convenient locale- right in the Glendale Galleria.  Call ahead of time if you want to know when the costumed Red Robyn will be visiting- the kids go crazy!

The review would have been a 3 or 4 until the end of our meal. So we were on vacation and we were looking for a place that was decent and great for kids, so I suggested Red Robin's and this one was near our hotel. We got there and was seated right away. Our waitress was very friendly and served us promptly. We were all full and stated how good the burgers were. It was not until we got our check that our entire experience went down the drain. There was a bus-boy who was clearing a table right next to us. I look up and the bus-boy who was chewing tobacco spit directly into the bucket that he was collecting the dishes in. Then part of my other party said that they saw him do it again. Needles to say I have never been so disgusted in my life. We told our waitress and she asked if we would like to tell her manager. The manager came over, we told her. She just looked kind of puzzled and left our table. She never returned back to our table to say anything further about the situation. However our waitress did return just to say that the manager would speak to the bus-boy. While we were waiting for our change, we proceeded to get dirty looks for other waitress' as if we broke some sort of code for telling on this person. I will never frequent another Red Robin again. I was utterly sick for the rest of the evening. I can't even imagine what else happens at this place. I used to like Red Robins. Thanks Glendale Red Robin for ruining any future experiences that I would have had here.

Goooooooooood after noon folks, this by far has always been one of my favorite resturants, service is great, food is well priced, they have a great happy hour. The food is also very delicious. I highly recommend . Two thumbs up.
Finally heard from management at Red Robins ,Glendale manager sent me a gift card. Glad it can be used at any red robins as I don't think I'd return to Glendale. Maybe.

I had lunch at this Red Robin recently.     Yeah, I'd say they're pulling out of their slump quite well.   The food was very good, service was quick, friendly, and helpful Going to have to start recommending them again

If you're ever in the glendale galleria and are thirtsty, pop in to reb robin and try their freckled(strawberry) lemonade! It's chock ful of fresh strawberries, in fresh tart lemonade. Perfect for quenching your shopping thirst! A long time favorite of mine is their creamy garlic & herb chicken pasta,  marinated chicken breast with a garlic-parmesan butter and sauteed with basil, mushrooms and tomatoes,and a creamy Alfredo sauce. This entree is served w/ their house bread, which a garlicky cheesy delight. I always order a separate side of their bread:)  This said, when my stomach is happy, I can go back to shopping!

Order the Mushroom swiss burger and get the garlic fries. $10 is the best deal for unlimited "steak" fries. Great place to bring your kids too and the drinks are usually stiff. The wife is usually a vegetarian and she always find something good there - this time it's a teriyaki bowl. Whoever you're eating with, make sure someone orders a burger so everyone can share with the fries. Did I mention I like the fries?

okay food in a tacky atmosphere, not too pricey, and the chicken fingers are good!  fries are hit or miss, and the waiters usually act kind of strange. and if you're nice you might even be allowed to order from the kids menu...

I really don't like burgers but when it comes to RR, I devour them. When I come here I make sure I come on a weekday because it tends to be slow. I come here to indulge in a juicy burger and I don't mind the calories. I come here at least 3X a year and enjoy  the gourmet cheeseburger, well-done with cheddar cheese, fries w ranch, and a regular Coke! This is the only time I also enjoy a Coke since I regularly drink teas. The staff here is also  friendly and they also have a bar.

There's only a few things in life that can stray me from my diet and one of them is Red Robin.  This location is the closest to me (I live in Pasadena) and it's definitely worth the 15 minute drive to indulge in my favorite Banzai Burger + Unlimited Fries.... This location makes my second favorite Banzai Burger (Cerritos Mall is my #1) - just the right amount of teriyaki sauce and enough fixins to keep me content well into my next meal. Tip for the fries: taste delicious with Honey Mustard. And also... if you're feeling hungry feel free to ask for fries before you get your burger. After all - they are unlimited.  Additionally, the BF loves the freckled lemonade - I think it's too sweet so I opt for the peach iced tea. Also, if you're still feeling thirsty when all done..., ask for a to go cup and now you're off to go shopping (they just opened a Target 10 steps away from the Red Robin mall entrance!)

Here I go again with my love for cheeseburgers! A definite go to for Wimpy's favorite (popeye's friend) The strawberry lemonade is also great! Especially with this heat. Go treat yourself to an all American Restaurant. One of my personal faves!! A+++

came here to watch the game. we order drink and chip dip. worst service ever. our total came out to 7 dallor 13 cents. we gave 20 and the waiter never came back with our change. so we asked and he was liike ohh I thought it was for us to keep the rest. I was like wth.

I've been to Red Robin's before -- however, this place was a bit lower than what I had expected. Our waitress was almost non-existent, we had to flag down other waiters to get more fries and refills. By the time my burger came out, the cheese was already starting to congeal -- a clear sign that it had been sitting out way too long. Same for my partner's order. I probably wouldn't eat at this location again -- might as well walk over to the In'N'Out and save some money.
I ate the best burger I've ever had There, it's a very fun atmosphere great for the whole family

The burgers here are pretty good and they have lots of selections of them.  That is why I like this place.  My favorites are the Whiskey River BBQ and Chili burgers.  My husband is a big fan of the clam chowder too.  I also loves the shakes.  So yummy.  Everything is pretty reasonably priced too.        The endless fries are cool, in theory.  The reason I say that is because they hardly ever offer to refill them (this has been true with 3 different Red Robins that I have gone too).  The same goes with the drinks.  What is with them and refillable stuff?  Why offer it if you aren't willing to actually follow through?   Oh well!   Aside from the lack of refill thing, the service is usually pretty good.  I have to second "Christi D" by singing the praises of one server in particular - BRANDON!  This guys is AWESOME!  He is super friendly, funny, helpful, and available.  Whenever I go back, I am going to request him and hope that he is there.  That guy is a complete joy to interact with.  I have a feeling that he would have a smile on his face no matter what he was doing.  He was my waiter over 3 months ago, and I still remember the guy.  That is how great he is!

We don;t go there because its the finest cuisine, but the fact is the food is pretty good, prices are reasonable, the draught beer is good, the staff is great. we usually go on birthdays for the comp burgrer (and they always come out with a birthday sundae) It all seems so obvious because we never have  a bad time there  You would think more was required but recently we have seen service plummet here in LA and Red Robin still gives you a decent meal with a nice experience - an endangered species
the fries were great but the burgers not so much. im not really a fan of their burgers...quiet mediocre nothing to rave about or look forward to but their nachos are pretty gooooood :D
The food was really good. I liked that they brought my food really quick but I felt pressure to order. The waitress was very nice and friendly.

My fiancé and I had some light shopping to do and wanted a nice burger before heading home. I'm pregnant and was CRAVING fries and red robins are my favorite. But once we sat down at the bar, we knew our experience was going to be terrible. We are both in this industry, so we know what to expect when dining out and how we should be treated. First off, the older bartender Mike, took about 10 minutes to take our order, which seemed to be a big inconvenience to him. We had to ask for the bar to be cleaned, never got silverware, or refills. My fiancé got the quesadilla and I got just a regular cheeseburger. Mike kept wiping his nose and never once washed his hands and I watched him serve beer,glasses of wine, AND my finances sprite. DISGUSTING. We said please and thank u and never got a response from him. A server had brought back a martini that a guest didn't like and he made the biggest ordeal about it for nothing. I am a bartender and what the guest was asking for, which was for it to be colder, is about as simple as filling a glass of water. My fries I was craving was a child size handful, and when I asked for more, again, it seemed to be such an inconvenience. 10 minutes later, my Luke warm child sized handful of fries came. By this time, we were ready to go. Might I add, mike still never washed his hands. Mike was off doing whatever, and the server Derick came and cleared our plates and gave us our bill. I'd like to make a note that the 30 second experience we had with Derick was the only nice thing about our visit. Mike came and cashed us out, and we were off. There was absolutely no one in the place, I don't understand how our service was so bad. We will never come back.

I was totally shocked that I had a good experience here.  The service was great and the food was actually pretty good.  Even though we just had wings and more wings...the guys were cool and the beers kinda saved my life.

Red Robins can be as a ran as fast, efficient operation where service comes with speed and you can taste the pride in the food. Well you can throw all of that out at this location. The service was painfully slow, the food also was slow even though the place was less then a third full. I know most places are trying to conserve money by hiring less experienced staff but you need to balance it out with better training. They are also renovating the restroom so I'm not going to ding them for that, but the greeter should have given us a booth further away from the renovation area.

yaaaaay i love bottomless fries! everytime i go here i can never decide what burger i want. never. i take like 20 mins and by that time the waiter is a pissy like "what the hell is taking you so damn long?". never had a bad experience here... the waiters/waitresses are super nice and on top of thier job and the food is always always good. get anything with the crispy onion pieces on it... your breath will stank but you'll enjoy it like its your last meal on earth!

the food is ok, the waitstaff is friendly, but i swear on everything that once I ordered a salad and there was a LIVE LADYBUG IN IT. Not a joke. I was pretty grossed out. It was just crawling through the salad, having the time of it's life eating my food. WTF. If it had been any other bug rather than a ladybug I probably would have thrown up, but I think ladybugs were cute so I wasn't TOO upset.
friendly staff, i like their fish and chips, great margarita

What I love about this place is that you can substitute a Gardenburger on any of their hamburgers. I get tired of the same ol' Garderburger offered at other places so variety is much appreciated. i had the ever so juicy BANZAI Burger sans the funny lookin' cheddar. The chocolate malt was hell-a good,  so damn good you feel naughty.But the bottomless fries looked like they were found at the bottom of something so I didn't eat them.

2 words for you: UNLIMITED FRIES! and those aren't just any fries... THICK ONES TOO.  I usually don't write reviews on chains like Red Robins, but I think i'll make an exception this one time. Red Robins is one of those places you go when you want quality gourmet burgers and lot of fries. You will for sure come out of that place a pound or two heavier. haha. So if u are on a diet, dont plan on going there.  I personally like their Hawaiian bbq burger (and the blue cheese burger). But they have other great things as well.  The staff and service is outstanding, and you will hear animated waiters singing happy birthday there all the time.  5 stars for being the best burger joint ever.

Haven't been in agessss..but from what i remember it was pretty good. It's in a mall so you can't expect tooo much. But overall good food and good service.  Good place to go during the holliday season when the mall cafeteria is PACKED and you need to take a break from all that shopping.

Okay, so it's a chain.  But the turkey burgers are really good!  I don't eat a lot of this kind of food, so I'm picky and consider it a treat.  I am never disappoionted.  The service is fast and efficient, and the booths comfy. What more do you want when you need to rest your feet after shopping in The Big Brown Cave (Galleria)?

The burgers are made with a thick ground beef. Their Mushroom Burger is the best. Unlimited fries that aren't bad at all. Goes swell with the lemonade they have. If your crazing soup try the try the Tortilla Soup.  Yay recommended.

things that are really bomb: whiskey river burger clucks 'n' fries chili cheese fries (not on the menu though) chili chili nachos just-in-quesadilla bottomless steak fries mozzarella sticks...basically anything fried.

Nov. 29, 2008: After window-shopping at the Glendale Galleria, food was the next best thing.  We chose Red Robin, which I haven't been to in such a long time.  Glad that I got to return finally because I've been waiting to take on the bottomless fries that they have.  Me and two friends all ordered the Clucks & Fries.  It's a Red Robin specialty that includes the bottomless steak fries.  My friends all got the fries without salt and ate them with ketchup.  But for me, I got the garlic fries...hmmm garlic...all chopped up and diced into itty-bitty morsels and sprinkled atop.  Even so, the garlic taste was not too strong...it was enough of a kick to make it enjoyable.  The chicken fingers were crisp and well-proportioned cuts thrown into the right amount of peppered batter.  The ranch dressing went well with the garlic steak fries, which I prefer over ketchup sometimes.  If I wanted to switch it up, I could've easily ordered another basket of them anyways and eat them with other condiments so there's plenty of room for mistakes or experimentation!  I also felt like drinking a lemonade so I ordered the bottomless blueberry pomegranate limeade (made with Monin pomegranate), which was a new beverage on the menu.  The drink came in a beautifully aesthetic twist glass.  The glass was crafted and blown with a streak of red to accent the tastefulness that was about to be sipped.  A halved fresh lime wedges, squeezed and thrown in, added to the fizz from the Sprite mixed in.  The round blueberries were also swirled into different edges and layers of the cup along with the lime syrups.  I popped the blueberries in my mouth with the straw and it was so sweet!  This was a great yin-and-yang for the slight sourness that I was craving...no wonder Red Robin says in their menu that uncontrollable "yummy" noises might result from it!  For $3.99 and having to drink 3 cups...it was pretty worth my penny.  Plus, our waiter Erick was the perfect server because we didn't even ask for a refill and he brought a whole new cup, without getting our order wrong and right when we were about to finish our drink...such great timing!  Good, good, good...

i usually have a good experience when i go to red robin in general. i ordered a lemonade. regular or strawberry? mmm... strawberry! my mom gets an iced tea. we order a onion ring tower and i get a california chicken burger and my mom gets some wrap. the strawberry lemonade was really good. the onion rings were pretty good. piping hot but a little salty. my chicken burger was... not so good. the bread was so dry and brittle, it fell apart when i tried to eat it. it made me feel like the bread was old. i dont know. then the bacon in it didnt even seem real. i dunno, maybe its always like that but it seemed like some precooked kind that they just have to heat up. did they even heat it up? i dunno. my moms wrap was ehh ok. she didnt even eat it. we had to decided if we really wanted to take the leftovers home, because would we even eat it at home? no. we got our check and OMG $40 freakin dollars?!? are you kidding me? geez. how come this time everything seemed so much more expensive? is it the economy? our waitress was friendly though. a little too rehearsed but eh ok. i felt like she got me when she asked me if i wanted strawberry lemonade or regular. and then again when she asked me if i wanted a refill. damnit!!! no free refills on the strawberry lemonade. i should have known.

You know what. .i like this place a lot. Their french fries are great with the yummy red robin seasoning (almost a cajun spice to it) and i like how many of the orders come with melon but the service was just terrible at this location-maybe they were having a bad day? the place was not busy and there were a lot of staff but i honestly didnt know who our waitress/waiter was - REALLY was it a man or a woman? I think most of the time we were there, we were looking for someone or anyone to help us - at one point i had remembered the hostess' face and confused her for our waitress..the food took forever to come out, our condiments were not full on our table, the food was not as hot as i would like and the bbq sauce in my wrap was nothing to brag about (but being from the south i will give them a break). it was obvious that other people were not too enthused about their service either. We overheard a waiter that sounded like a car salesman..Annoying! Hopefully,( if we even go back) we will not get snubbed like this again and maybe the busser wont have to clean our table then bring us our check..
